position: SNSR Fusion: Computer Science / Computer Vision Intern
description:
Greetings everyone, hope you're all greetings everyone, hope you're all staying safe and well through the pandemic.

We are looking for a couple of internship roles to fill. The position would start fairly quickly and you would be working with a team of five currently.

You know what they say, talent is important but chemistry is more crucial for us. Feel free to click apply if youre interested in early stage gig. Cheers!

Keywords: software development, Python, C, C++, Visual Studio, Linux, CUDA, Computer Vision, TensorFlow, Keras, embedded software, debugging, multithreading, multiprocessing, CPU, GPU, Arduino, Raspberry Pi, NVIDIA, OpenCV, augmented reality, machine learning

  • Has worked on multiple computer vision projects that utilize some type of learning model with object detection
  • Ideally has worked on CV projects involving vehicle detection
  • Has 2-3 years of experience using various object detection algorithms such as Haar Cascade, SSD, Yolo, Yolo-Lite
  • Knows working principle of CNN and math behind
  • Experience with deep learning model optimization
  • Relevant experience with camera calibration and/or camera evaluation
  • Has a foundational knowledge of neural networks
  • Knows how to work with neural network libraries like Keras and machine learning libraries like TensorFlow
  • Has 1-2 years of augmented reality experience with
  • Has worked with CV and machine learning on both mobile (such as ARM), and dedicated CPU and GPU such as NVIDIA GTX 1080 ti
  • Has strong experience scripting bash in Linux environments
  • Has project experience scripting with Arduino, Raspberry Pi, and NVIDIA processing hardware (such as Jetson Nano, TX-2, Xavier, GTX 1080, 1081, RTX 2080, 3080, etc.)
  • Has project experience managing position tracking of multiple objects at one time
  • Ideally has past experience with management of wireless and remote access points through UDP or TCP protocols is a plus
  • iOS and Android app development experience is a plus
  • Comfortable coding in C-based languages, Python, (Javascript and XML are plusses)

About the job

We're looking for a Full-stack Software Developer intern to work on an internal project. The project is an ElectronJS desktop app that aggregates analytics from several API sources like Instagram API.

Key learnings

  • Full-Stack development and real time implementation
  • React native and React JS

Key responsibilities

  • Familiarity with JavaScript and web technologies.
  • Familiarity with 3rd-party API integration.
  • Know React and have built components with it.
  • Familiar with git.
  • Know frontend development in React JS
  • Know backend development in nodejs and mongodb for database.
  • Develop and manage well-functioning databases and applications
  • Experience with cloud infrastructure (AWS/GCP), Firebase.
  • Write documentation, maintain code and write automated tests to ensure the product is of the highest quality. Test software to ensure responsiveness and efficiency.
  • Good UI/UX skills. Ability to design user-flow based on business logic and customer requirements.
  • Design client-side and server-side architecture.

Requirements

You should be self-driven and hungry for more knowledge.
You should be proficient in English.
You should be interested in creative designing, curious and willing to learn.
You should be available and willing to go through a training period of a week.
You must be willing to work remotely and have a good internet connection at all times.
You should be available to work/learn/contribute for at least 20 hours/week.
You should be available for a minimum of 2 months.

position: For Students & Recent Grads - Junior Full Stack Developer
description:
Hopeful Inc. is a fast growing startup focused on creating new technologies for nonprofits looking to tell compelling stories to the right people, at the right time, in order to maximize donations.

We are currently seeking a student or recent graduate Full Stack Developer to assist our Chief Technology Officer and technology team in bringing our product offerings to scale-readiness. You will have the opportunity to work on unique analytics and optimization projects within the nonprofit sector, directly working with clients that have a positive impact on their communities and the world at large.

At Hopeful, we are committed to building and fostering an environment where our employees feel included, valued, and heard. Our belief is that a strong commitment to diversity and inclusion enables us to truly make commerce better for everyone. We strongly encourage applications from Indigenous people, racialized people, people with disabilities, people from gender and sexually diverse communities and/or people with intersectional identities.

*Roles & Responsibilities *

  • Should have hands on experience with backend technologies and play the role of full stack developer when required
  • Capable of picking up on the needs and challenges of the product rapidly, being able to devise design solutions that will support the product/technical strategy and goals.
  • Ensure technical expectations of deliverables are met.
  • Maintains strong expertise and knowledge of current and emerging technologies and products.
  • Can quickly identify framework options and provide comparison/justification for selection.
  • Proactively suggest tools and technologies that will benefit the construction of the final product

Required Skills

  • Should have experience working with Java programming and Spring-boot/Hibernate web application development.
  • Have basic familiarity with working with payments and partner integration APIs such as Stripe, Paypal.
  • Experience using cutting edge technologies like Kafka, MongoDB, Redis, React, Redux, Redux-Saga, ES6, Babel, Webpack etc.
  • Proficiency in MySQL, NoSQL databases.
  • Solid understanding of CI/CD pipelines using Gitlab/Github.
  • Good to have experience in software engineering principles, object design, security, data interchange, data management etc.

Nice To Have

  • Solid understanding of IAAC using Terraform and Helm/Tiller etc.
  • Solid understanding of Kubernetes services, pods, deployments, ingress and Istio.
  • Experience working with distributed architecture and services with external vendor integration are nice to have.

Want to make an impact this fall? At Assured, you'll work with a 6 person team of extraordinarily passionate engineers working to reimagine the insurance industry.

🧱 Get in on a startup on truly the ground floor. Together, we'll shape the future of the company.
🏡 Housing is included! We're all living together in a house in Palo Alto, and the living room is the office.
💸 Highly competitive pay. If we love you, we'll pay whatever it takes.
🛫 Ever wanted to be a pilot? One free flying lesson from our co-founder.

Who we are...

Assured aims to disrupt the insurance industry by modernizing its most archaic component: claims. Currently, 300,000 claims adjusters spend their days talking on the phone and typing into unstructured text fields. We can do better—by combining logic, inference, and modern computer vision tools, we're able to both increase efficiency and improve customer satisfaction. By rearchitecting how the underlying information is ingested and stored, we're poised to impact the core of a trillion dollar industry.

We're two second time founders out of Stanford who care about transforming the world with software. We've built companies from enterprise software to aerospace, and couldn't be more excited about taking on the insurance industry. We are looking for our first intern to work with us as we continue building out our product and deploying it to some of the largest insurance carriers in the world.

There's so much to do. We can't wait for you to join us.

You'd love this role if...

🔥 You're passionate about reimagining archaic industries
🖖 You want to work on a small, close knit team of brilliant engineers consumed by a consequential and yet-unsolved problem
🐾 Being a trailblazer—in our architecture, in our approach, and in our team—is an inspiration, not a burden

You will...

🌱 Grow as an engineer with our help, working across the stack as you own features from ideation to production
🗣️ Interact with stakeholders ranging from end-users to insurance adjusters
💎 Use modern frontend frameworks like React and GraphQL to build single-page applications
🔎 Collaborate with the CEO and CTO to identify and prioritize the most impactful improvements to our product
😍 Implement delightful, functional user experiences

You may be a fit if you...

🔧 Build software to solve problems
💪 Have substantial, self-initiated projects that you're proud of
🚀 Want to dive into the world of startups

Bonus points...
✨ We're currently using Typescript, Node.js, React, and GraphQL, however that will evolve. The most important thing is that you're nimble, intelligent, and hard working.

At Snorkel AI, we’re redefining how people and organizations build AI applications. Snorkel started as a research project in the Stanford AI Lab in 2016, creating a higher-level interface to machine learning through programmatically labeled and managed training data. From deploying in some of the world’s largest and most sophisticated tech organizations to empowering scientists, doctors, and journalists — we’ve seen firsthand how this approach democratizes and accelerates AI. Now, we’re building Snorkel Flow to bring our technology to everyone!

Snorkel Flow is the data-first platform for enterprise AI. Modern AI approaches require massive labeled training datasets to learn from, which traditionally rely on armies of human annotators to label by hand. In Snorkel Flow, users programmatically label, build, and augment training data to drive a radically faster, more flexible, and higher quality end-to-end AI development and deployment process. Snorkel Flow is an end-to-end development platform, complete with a GUI and powerful programmatic interfaces for driving the development process for full AI application workflows: from preprocessing, to programmatic training data creation, to ML model training, to analysis, and deployment. Building Snorkel Flow requires best-in-class engineers and technologies across the stack, including scalable data pipelines, elegant and intuitive interfaces (both visual and programmatic), state-of-the-art ML modeling techniques, and best practices for seamless deployment.

As an Engineering Intern, you’ll work on a project motivated by Snorkel's ongoing engagements with customers, with opportunities for both end-to-end ownership and mentorship. In our fast-moving startup environment, we look for engineers who are versatile, proactive, and excited to dive into solving real-world problems. Expect to be treated as a full member of the team, with regular opportunities for giving and receiving feedback and observing up close the workings of a high-growth startup.

Main Responsibilities

  • Work with a mentor and engineering team to develop customer solutions and platform improvements
  • Analyze objectives and evaluate results to choose the best solution to effectively solve problems
  • Design new features, make product recommendations, and generally help make Snorkel Flow a platform AI practitioners love to use

Preferred Qualifications

  • Pursuing a BS/MS/PhD in Computer Science or a related field
  • Available to work full time for a minimum of 12 weeks and return to a degree program after completion of the internship
  • Skilled in Software Development and coding in Python and/or JavaScript
  • Experience working on large, collaborative coding projects
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and strong technical communication skills

Be Your Best At Snorkel
At Snorkel AI, we actively work to create an environment that values end-to-end ownership, diverse forms of impact, and opportunities personal growth. Snorkelers are supported by an amazing team and an amazing set of benefits. We offer comprehensive medical, dental, and vision plans for Snorkelers and their families, plus a yearly wellness stipend. Our 401k program lets Snorkelers plan for their future with a 100% match up to 5% of annual salary. Learn more about these benefits and more — like our workstation setup allowance — on our Careers page.

Snorkel AI is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity employer and is committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. Snorkel AI embraces diversity and provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment. Snorkel AI prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type on the basis of race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, performance, merit, and business need.

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

The Graduate Technology Fellow Program is the latest installment to broaden S&S's impact by developing technological solutions and building an early-career network for the top programmers, developers, and web engineers passionate in creating innovative technologies to solve current and future sustainability issues. We are now accepting applications for the 2019 class of Graduate Technology Fellows.

1) Develop new technologies to address pressing sustainability issues around the world

2019 Graduate Technology Fellow Primary Responsibilities:

3) An enthusiasm and ability to productively work in a remote team

We have two internship opportunities with our Tucson-based startup, Inara.

The Software Developer helps with the development of our current project, a Streaming Ebooks Micropayments platform and mobile web application using a SDK based on the Hedera distributed ledger network and consensus algorithm. The duties primarily revolve around building software by writing code, as well as modifying software to fix errors, adapt it to new hardware, improve its performance, or upgrade interfaces. The Software Developer will be involved in directing system testing and validation procedures, and also working with customers and Management Team on technical issues including software system design and maintenance.

• Designing and developing software systems using scientific analysis and mathematical models to predict and measure outcomes and design consequences.
• Modifying software to fix errors, adapt it to new hardware, improve its performance, or upgrade interfaces.

• Directing software programming and documentation development.
• Consulting with Management Team and Customer Advisory Board on project status and proposals.
• Working Management Team and Customer Advisory Board on technical issues including software system design and maintenance.
• Analyzing information to recommend and plan the installation of new systems and modifications of an existing system.
• Consulting with Product Manager to evaluate software-hardware interfaces and develop specifications and performance requirements.
• Preparing reports on programming project specifications, activities, or status.
• Conferring with Product Manager to obtain information on limitations or capabilities.

Must be authorized to work in U.S.

We are committed to providing a superior internship experience including an engineering and other hands-on training. Our commitment extends to working with our interns in their career development. We tie the internship to our interns' formal education program whenever possible.

If this all sounds like you, contact us today and let’s talk about creating a new future.

About Inara
Inara is a tokenized ebooks economy that enables authors to get paid directly for every page stream of their ebooks and for readers to participate in ebooks curation with an incentivized design. When the page turns, the author earns.

Inara CEO Glenn McCreedy founded Breakaway Media LLC—among the first publishing companies in 2009 to publish and sell on Amazon’s Kindle Direct Publishing platform. We sold nearly a million ebooks over the years and our title, THE SHOP, bumped The Hunger Games off Amazon’s number one spot.

We realized that we and other authors in our network were increasingly challenged to earn a living with Amazon’s tightening algorithms, thousands of authors joining the platform every month, and the downward pricing pressure on ebooks all the way to “free.” Now, authors are forced to buy ads from Amazon to get visibility and sell on KDP. We founded Inara and built an ebook ecommerce platform to help authors break free and get paid directly so they can earn a living and write the great books that readers want to read.

Today, Inara is a proud cohort member of the Hedera Boost startup program — hedera.com/boost. We are building on the success of our existing platform and designing a new category, Streaming Ebooks Micropayments that is transforming the publishing industry.

At Inara, you will always have your best opportunity to contribute and develop yourself. We have fun and strive to lift each other up. We prize initiative and creativity and believe that each member of the team is a leader serving others.

Role and Responsibilities of the Position:

The Summer Intern assists with development of our current project, a Streaming Ebooks Micropayments platform and mobile web application using a SDK based on the Hedera distributed ledger network and Consensus Algorithm. The Inara core hypothesis will be tested with the Minimum Viable Product developed by the Inara dev team. The duties primarily revolve around building software by writing code, as well as modifying software to fix errors, adapt it to new hardware, improve its performance, or upgrade interfaces. The Summer Intern will be involved in conducting system testing and validation procedures, and also working with customers and Management Team on technical issues including software system design and maintenance.

• Designing and developing software systems using scientific analysis and mathematical models to predict and measure outcomes and design consequences.
• Modifying software to fix errors, adapt it to new hardware, improve its performance, or upgrade interfaces.
• Conducting system testing and validation procedures.
• Conducting software programming and documentation development.
• Consulting with Management Team, Hedera Team, and Customer Advisory Board on project status and proposals.
• Working Management Team and Customer Advisory Board on technical issues including software system design and maintenance.
• Analyzing information to recommend and plan the installation of new systems and modifications of an existing system.
• Consulting with Product Manager to evaluate software-hardware interfaces and develop specifications and performance requirements.
• Preparing reports on programming project specifications, activities, or status.
• Conferring with Product Manager to obtain information on limitations or capabilities.

We are interested in interns with the following experience and skills:

Front-End React development and/or development with other front-end frameworks. Mobile Web development. UX/UI design. Prototyping/Wireframing. RESTful APIs design. Use of databases: relational and non-relational. Use of Cloud services.

React.js, ReactNative, HTML, CSS, Bootstrap, Node.js, Python, Ruby on Rails, C++, JavaScript, Figma, Adobe XD, Invision.

Experience with back-end frameworks such as Flask and Django preferred.

Familiarity with Hedera Hashgraph (hedera.com) and/or blockchain and cryptocurrency, a plus.

Work from your remote location.

Nature of the Internship:

This is an unpaid internship position.

(1) The training in the field of Computer Science is similar to and enhances instruction given in studies at institutions of higher learning.
(2) The internship is for your benefit to receive training and mentoring, and to provide valuable experience for future job selection, application, and performance in the field of Computer Science.
(3) You will work under the close observation of mentors at the Company.
(4) Unless advised otherwise, interns are not entitled to a job at the conclusion of the internship period.
(5) You are not entitled to wages or other compensation other than your experience and learning for the time spent as an intern for the Company.
(6) The internship does not create an "employment" relationship under the Fair Labor Standards Act ("FLSA") or any other definition, and the FLSA's minimum wage and overtime provisions do not apply.

Start Date: Immediately
End Date: August 31, 2020
Number of hours per week: 20

description:
We're looking for a motivated front-end developer intern to use their technical skills for building custom websites and running JavaScript experiments.

Responsibilities

    • Primarily vanilla JS DOM manipulation

Required Skills & Experience

  • Proficient in HTML/CSS/JS – basic knowledge in PHP is a plus
  • Experience with WordPress (themes or custom builds)
  • Detail focused & capable of closely following designs
  • Strong communication and writing skills
  • Attention to detail and highly dependable work ethic
  • Experience with working remotely/ self-guided work
  • Ability to learn and adapt quickly to change

Location

Position may be based anywhere in the continental United States. May require some travel.

COMPANY DESCRIPTION

Epoch Games is a volunteer based, all-online, global game development team (we have no centrally-located headquarters). Most of the original founding members were modders developing the total conversion Middle Earth Roleplaying Project (MERP) mod for the Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim:
http://www.moddb.com/mods/merp-middle-earth-roleplaying-project

Currently Epoch Games is developing Lays of Althas: Sundered Order (LoA:SO). LoA:SO is an in-development indie open-world RPG set in an original fantasy world. The game is being developed using Epic Games' Unreal Engine 4 (UE4):
https://www.unrealengine.com/

For more information about the game, please check out our IndieDb page:
http://www.indiedb.com/games/the-lays-of-althas-sundered-order

JOB DESCRIPTION

In this volunteer position you will be working closely with other members of the Coding department to develop C++ code for the Lays of Althas: Sundered Order (LoA:SO). Keep in mind that we are using Epic Game’s Unreal Engine 4 (UE4) to develop the game, and knowledge of how C++ code interacts with UE4 is required. Knowledge of Blueprint scripting in UE4 is recommended, but not required.

Communication is key to a smooth and efficient pipeline, you must be able to communicate clearly and effectively with other team-members and not be afraid to ask should any problems arise. We are an English-speaking team, so English fluency is a must.

If you are comfortable with teaching, you may be called upon to aid the more junior members of the team in any relevant area.

Other duties include: attending Slack meetings (Slack is an instant messaging we communicate with); completing monthly reports; and following team policies.

This is a volunteer position, so no monetary compensation is being offered.

At this time, we are having to rely upon free (or previously licensed) software. Please refer to the applications listed below for guidelines. We do not endorse piracy.

QUALIFICATIONS

Minimum Skill Requirements:

  • C++ programming experience.
  • Unreal Engine 4 and how C++ code interacts with it
  • Providing clear and legible code.
  • Online communication and Team-collaboration skills.
  • A passion for coding and a dedication to creating AAA quality games.
  • At least 1 Unreal Engine project (using C++) prepared to show prior to the interview.

Optional Skill Requirements:

  • Blueprint scripting experience

SOFTWARE REQUIREMENTS

Required Software:

  • Unreal Engine 4 (https://www.unrealengine.com/register)

Recommended Software:

  • GitHub (https://www.unrealengine.com/ue4-on-github)
  • GitLab (what we use for version control of our project)
  • Eclipse IDE for C++ (http://www.eclipse.org/downloads/packages/eclipse-ide-cc-developers/lunasr1), Visual Studio Community 2017 (https://visualstudio.microsoft.com/downloads/), and/or Notepad++ (http://www.notepad-plus-plus.org/download/v6.6.6.html)

description:
We offer year-round internship opportunities

What time of the year do you hire interns and new grads?
We hire year-round and offer flexible 3, 6, 8 and 12-month work terms.

Working at Genity
We’re solving the world’s most important problems, and are looking for talented, driven, and passionate individuals who share our passion to change the world. Our culture is fast-paced, energetic and innovative. We work to build an inclusive environment in which everyone, regardless of gender, race, religion, age, or background, can do their best work.

Why us?
Our year around program places the best students in positions that they will grow both technically, personally, and professionally through their experience here. We are dedicated to providing an experience that allows for the intern to experience life at Genity with projects that are critical to their team’s success.

Instead of going on coffee runs and making copies, you’ll be seated at the table making critical decisions that will influence not only your team, but also the achievement of our mission.

Required

  1. Currently working towards or a recent graduate of a BS, MS, PhD program in STEM

How to apply?
Please specify how much you have of in the requirements list, why you'd like to work with us, and an example of something you've built or worked on that you're proud of. Additionally, a pdf or google doc of your resume should be attached as well.

Hiring Process

  1. Submit Application and Cover Letter
  2. Zoom/Skype/Google Hangout call
  3. Test with one of our engineers over Zoom/Skype/etc...

Do interns and/or co-ops get hired back full time?
Yes. Based on Genity’s current hiring needs and the student’s proven performance.

position: Real Estate Rental Focused Startup Seeking Developers
description:
Concept: Innovative, greatly overlooked and extremely disruptive concept for the trillion dollar market sized residential real estate industry. An online marketplace concept where Tenants have a greatly expanded degree of options when renting and Landlords obtain premiums to market rents in the local market for offering these options.

The Company’s goal is to become the #1 source for online residential leasing and related services in the world and to change forever how leasing is done for the betterment of all parties involved.

Founder: Former investment banker, private equity executive, and top business development executive and strategist at Inc5000 tech company. Most recently a startup consultant who identified all the major missteps we won’t be taking in growing this company. Founder is advised by a handful of successful tech executives in his circle. Two entrepreneurs that have a similar background to the Founder: Jeff Bezos and Michael Bloomberg.

Funding: Bootstrapped for now. Focused on profitability to grow, we reject the cash-burn growth model - a business’s purpose is to provide an excellent service to its customers and to make money through that process.

Position

Part-Time Developer (Front End and Back End Needed)

What is Needed:

  • A general to passionate interest in residential real estate and a desire to seriously change the options available in the market to consumers while increasing landlord profits.

  • Intermediate to Advanced software engineering skills, preferably with a focus in Javascript. We are looking in total for one front end and one backend developer to compliment a UI/UX designer. There will be four of us total in the initial team.

  • A curious, inquisitive nature that is comfortable working with little to no guidance and creating solutions where there are no concrete and definitive answers (as we are developing them). Someone who can learn to problem solve on their own.

  • Someone open-minded, logical, analytical, independent, friendly and honest with a passionate work ethic who has the potential to grow into a leadership role whether at this company or elsewhere on their own.

  • Able to take direction and guidance at the early part of their career (now) with grace and humility while balancing this with speaking their mind and having courage to politely challenge the Founder when it's warranted. This is a difficult balance to find.

  • 10 hour minimum weekly commitment but more is gladly welcomed!

*What is in it for You: *

  • Amazing ground-floor startup experience, skills and resume builder. You are going to be the part of the team to build the app!

  • Early stage equity in a company focused on an enormous market led by a Founder who has a long track record of success.

  • The opportunity to work with and learn from a veteran of the high finance and consumer tech industry who:

    * Has successfully designed and executed on five different
    marketing and sales strategies.

    * Has a very successful track record being the primary revenue
    driver at an Inc5000 company; personally bringing in over $8
    million in new sales along with successfully developing a
    successful new division that was profitable in its first operating
    month of existence.

    * Has a vision of building a billion dollar residential real-estate
    focused. consumer facing marketplace headquartered in St.
    Louis, MO.

    * Is committed to helping those who work with him achieve their
    own career goals.

    * Believes philosophically in listening to team members and taking
    their advice when it aligns with company goals and values.

  • A potential career if you perform and if you prefer to start your own business, a mentorship and guidance to get your going (including sharing knowledge and skills in fundraising, finance/accounting, strategy and execution, sales & marketing and more). The Founder wants those who help him achieve his dream to achieve their own and will assist those who help him as much as possible.

description:
Taste is looking for an AI / Full Stack Software Engineering intern to join the founding team in NYC!

We're helping amazing restaurants manage this incredibly difficult crisis. We've built and are quickly scaling a marketplace for Fine Dining at Home experiences so foodies can get their favorite restaurant experiences at home. For restaurants, we're bringing large orders to help them through this tough and unique period.

The initial team is a group of passionate ex-Google and Tesla engineers, and we're looking for an intern for the summer to help us scale our system and save more restaurants.

To apply, please send your resume to team+eng@gettaste.com.

Your responsibilities:

  • Design, build, test, and improve algorithms for delivery routing
  • Design, build, and test our operations dashboard
  • Ship backend and frontend features to our marketplace

  • 1+ years developing complex web applications
  • Proficient in Python, JavaScript

Nice to have:

  • Experience reducing NP Hard problems to other NP Hard problems

We are looking for highly qualified computer science or data science undergrads who are willing to work on highly innovative tough projects that will change the world. The internship lasts ten weeks and is unpaid. Please reach out with a resume and cover letter and we will schedule an interview if we are interested in you. Thanks.

NOTE: Due to Cov-19 situation, we can only start the interview process and make the offer remotely. You will not actually start until the government lift the stay home order

position: SEO and Coding Internship_Cross Country Road Trip
description:
A truly once in a lifetime summer internship. From May 16-August 1 author Jordan O'Donnell, his manager, Jake Harris, and eighteen interns will embark on a 10-week cross-country road trip to promote Mr. O'Donnell's forthcoming novel Zoon Garden: The Decline of Nation. The entire trip is employer provided, including one converted school bus, two RV trailers, and fuel. Interns will only be responsible for paying for their food. The team will travel through the majority of America, as well as shoot a documentary of the entire trip.

Mr. Harris and Mr. O'Donnell are searching for 1 to 2 individuals to support the tour's SEO and coding needs. Applicants should have high-level coding abilities including extensive experience with python, java, ruby and other popular programing languages. Applicants should also possess thorough knowledge of SEO to include Google Analytics, Google Trends and Google Search Console.

Duties Include:
• Maintaining the author’s website, including optimizing it for visibility and sales.
• Designing and coding the author’s website for optimal aesthetic appeal.
• Assisting media interns with social media maintenance and marketing

Pay: The author is a full-time writer, and as such his livelihood is contingent upon the book’s success and at this time he is only able to offer paid 1% commission. If the tour sells 10,000 copies (roughly $35,000), team payout will unfortunately be minimal, $350 per person. If the tour becomes a massive success and sells 300,000 copies (roughly $1,050,000), team payout will be $10,500, and so on and so forth. Regardless of sale numbers, all interns, in exchange for their work, will receive a free ten-week bus trip around the continental United States, including stops in numerous iconic cities and world-renowned sights.

Find further details at www.jordanodonnellauthor.com
APPLY NOW via Angellist or at www.jordanodonnellauthor.com/internships

position: Software Engineer with Computer Vision Background
description:
We look for software engineer candidates with computer vision background (preferably related to 3D) to join our team. You must have a minimum 2 years of industrial or lab experience in web app or mobile app development. Experience in SLAM and smartphone related imaging system design is a plus. Computer skills desired include JavaScript and Python. Must be able to work with a team. Excellent references are also required. B.S. or above in related fields preferred.

Located in Mclean, VA, Xyken is an emerging leader in mobile 3D imaging. Grow with us in this exciting field. Join us and learn/grow skills in 3D imaging, mobile programming, and mobile image processing in general. Competitive benefits.

About Us

Banyan Infrastructure combines financial and technological innovation to accelerate the deployment of solar, wind and other critical infrastructure around the globe. We use blockchain-based, smart contract technology to oversee and automate the complex and time consuming contractual compliance of renewable energy loans. Our platform enables lenders and borrowers to synthesize key insights and proactively mitigate risk with greater transparency across all counter parties, from origination to syndication.

About You

First and foremost, you have excellent written and verbal communication skills. You are also an energetic self-starter who shows personal initiative. In addition, you have or are interested in:
-- Strong analytical, troubleshooting and problem skills
-- Working knowledge of basic UNIX environments
-- Experience or knowledge of basic SQL
-- Experience in programming languages. Python or Java.
-- Experience working with functional programming

About The Role

We are looking for an intern that is undertaking a degree in Computer Science or study in a similar area. The intern will work with the product and engineering team at Banyan Infrastructure. This team is responsible for engineering and building our core product.

The Internship Will Be In Two Areas

Operations: The intern will work within a team deploying new software to our new and upcoming customers. The work will include change management procedures, automated and manual deployments and troubleshooting of technical issues. The role includes solving production issues in SaaS environments, working with the Banyan product team.

Engineering: The intern will undertake a project to develop one ore more features used within the Banyan core platform to enable lenders to more efficiently invest and enable renewable infrastructure.

What You will Receive

This is an unpaid position but you will receive standard perks while working, and you will get full exposure to the early days of startup life and challenges. You will walk away with incredible contacts in a blooming technical space, a rich item for your resume, and experience working with the Banyan engineering team which will make you a better software engineer forever. Banyan will also provide ongoing direct mentorship, professional references, and as you grow and we grow. potential FT positions in the future.

We look forward to hearing from you.

Yup is a system for determining the agreed-upon social value of anything on the Internet, from Tweets and YouTube videos to blogs and news articles. It provides stronger incentives for giving meaningful opinions online by allowing users to earn money and influence if their opinion is supported by other influential members of the community. When users rate content, people, or products they have both their reputation and potential income at stake, which results in better incentives for judging content meaningfully. Our goal is to create a universal, disintermediated layer of social consensus, where the agreed-upon social value of anything online can be determined without reliance on centralized platforms like YouTube or Twitter

We’re a group of technologists and product enthusiasts passionate about leveraging emerging technologies to solve hard problems in novel ways. Our team comes from diverse backgrounds with experiences at companies and institutions like Google, Microsoft, Chanel, and West Point. We believe that innovative technology combined with a strong product mindset can help us invent creative solutions that were never thought to be possible.

What you'll be doing:

  • Developing products for interacting with the Yup protocol and representing social influence and identity
  • Improving the performance, reliability, and quality of existing products and services (including our chrome extension, web app, and supporting services)
  • Building, testing, and deploying easy-to-use features with tools like React, Vue, ES6, styled components, and webpac

What we look for in you:

  • Experience with modern JavaScript/Node.js
  • Experience building user-facing features using component-based UI frameworks like React or Vue
  • Passion for building high quality, easy-to-use products
  • Solid communication skills and structured thinking
  • Attention to code quality, maintainability, and scalability
  • Self-starter who would thrive in fast-paced working environment

Nice to haves:

  • You've worked directly with production React or Vue apps, with significant usage
  • You have general knowledge / experience with blockchain and cryptocurrencies

location.city: New York City • San Francisco • Remote • Remote

description:
About Lunchclub

At Lunchclub we're helping people relevantly grow their professional network. We use AI to scale data-driven matches to thousands of people weekly, small groups of like-minded individuals, and panels with some of the world's best. We've introduced people who have started companies together, received/given mentorship, received funding, made their next hire, or friend. We're a small, tight-knit, but distributed team, powering connections in and in-between 57 cities across 6 continents.

About engineering at Lunchclub

We're a small team of generalist software engineers driving big outcomes with a lot of shared responsibility. We often work outside the traditional Fullstack/Backend/Frontend mould to create, fix, and improve Lunchclub for our users and fellow engineers. Our engineers also actively take part in discussions on product, design, user interviews, and more. The fastest way to learn technology is to build things at an early stage startup — we expect you to grow a lot as an engineer during your time here.

About the role

As a software engineer intern at Lunchclub you'll...

Build features from start to finish. Start with research or an idea, work with design to draft up a spec, build, launch, and polish.
Improve and iterate on existing features through A/B testing, user, or team feedback.
Build and improve existing internal tools, helping us maintain our team's high impact on our growing community.
Play an active role in the shaping of the future of the product and business.

This role could be for you if...

You love problem solving — especially with code.
You're looking to grow quickly as an engineer and do not fear ownership, even at an early stage of your career.
You know how to balance building quickly with building well.

Bonus: You're adept with Javascript/React, Python/Flask, MySQL, Docker.

Benefits

Flexible vacation time.
Hybrid remote/office work culture.

Lunchclub is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.

Learn more about us here: https://techcrunch.com/2019/09/18/lunchclub-raises-4m-from-a16z-for-its-ai-warm-intro-service.

At Seven Eight Capital, research is about working with the smartest quants on Wall Street to generate exceptional returns. Seven Eight is built around hiring the best team and enabling them to reach their full potential. Our quantitative developers are at the core of what we do, enabling research to scale and putting to work the newest software engineering developments.

Do you want to be in the business of quantitative trading? We are hiring computer scientists and mathematicians to team up with our experienced quantitative researchers to learn about quantitative finance markets. This internship requires little to no previous financial experience, but a high level of computer science or engineering skill with a desire to learn about finance.

Responsibilities:

  • Learn about quantitative finance through our intensive Seven Eight Capital intern training program. This program culminates with an independent project in which you will be paired with an expert mentor.
  • Compete a custom project based on your skills, interests and our trading environment.

Qualifications:

  • Graduating in 2022 or 2023 with a BS / MS / PhD from a top tier university in Computer Science / Machine Learning / Computer Engineering / Electrical Engineering / Computational Math or a similar intensive field.
  • Strong academic record.
  • Python programming ability.
  • Some advanced coursework in Mathematics.
  • High level understanding of Computer Science in some areas (e.g. ML, Computer Vision, NLP, Programming Languages, Distributed Computing).
  • Ability to clearly communicate, think independently and be an excellent problem solver.
  • Previous quantitative financial internships or tech internships with large data components (a plus).

Databases are the beating heart of every business in the world.

Cockroach Labs is the team behind CockroachDB, an open source, distributed SQL database. We strive to build infrastructure that keeps pace with the world, so developers can focus on what matters most: building the best products. Come and join us on our mission to Make Data Easy. Are you ready to aim high and build to last?

The Role

We are looking for extraordinary Backend, Full-stack, and Frontend Engineering Interns to join our team.

  • Design, code, and test the web frontend for CockroachCloud or the backend for our distributed, open source database, CockroachDB. You will bring your expertise to the table to provide the best user experience to our users, partners, and customers.
  • You will collaborate with web designers, product managers, and customers to create user friendly experience to deploy, manage, monitor CockroachDB. A huge bonus is that even after your experience at Cockroach Labs ends, your code will live on in our open source GitHub repo, CockroachDB. Come help us on our mission to Make Data Easy! ### The Expectations

In your first 30 days, you will become an integrated member of our engineering team. During this time, you will work on a starter project that allows you to gain confidence in navigating the code base and gain familiarity with our engineering environment. We believe that it's important for you to take this first month to become familiar with our technology and our company.

For the next 3 months, you will contribute to our codebase for CockroachDB, CockroachCloud, or our developer infrastructure. After wrapping up your starter project, you will work with your manager to focus your efforts on a project that aligns with your interests and the product roadmap.

You

  • You are pursuing or have recently completed studies in Computer Science or a related technical field, graduating between May 2021 and May 2023.
  • You have had exposure to coursework on subjects like distributed systems, concurrency control, data replication, file systems, or SQL processing.
  • Comfort using programming languages like Javascript, React, Redux, Go, C/C++, Java, and Python/Django. We use React.js, Redux, and Typescript on the client side and use Go on the server side. If you don't know any of these languages, you'll learn them while you're here.
  • You love building relationships with your colleagues. You enjoy being part of the code review process and partnering with your teammates on challenging problems.
  • You have past experience working on production-level code.
  • You are genuinely interested in Cockroach Labs' mission and are excited to use CockroachDB in your projects.

Our interview process consists largely of programming in a real environment, and we'll be evaluating you on the skills listed above.

Cockroach Labs is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer building a diverse and inclusive workforce. If you need additional accommodations to feel comfortable during your interview process, please email us at accessibility@cockroachlabs.com.

  • Previous internship experience or completed projects and coursework using CS fundamentals.

  • Proven ability to communicate complex concepts clearly and simply

How To Apply

Prune.ai presents a scientific approach to social media marketing. We are building an AI-powered marketplace to help businesses promote their products via word-of-mouth on social media. We have a MVP in stealth mode and are currently testing via closed beta.

The engineering team works directly with Machine Learning Scientists, so there is opportunity for significant technical learning. Our team includes a PhD, ex-Amazon, and people with 10+ years of experience. Our team of 5 is fully remote at the moment, but we'd prefer applicants from the US to maximize time-zone overlap.

Responsibilities:

  • Form a deep understanding of our users by interacting with them
  • A/B test various versions of our product, with statistical analysis of quantitative results
  • Work with UX researcher to design and prioritize new features for the product based on qualitative beta tests and quantitative A/B tests
  • Run marketing experiments and tweak marketing copy/messaging/design based on customer feedback
  • Basic front end development (coding), mostly html/css/javascript, working alongside front end developers

Qualifications:

  • Currently enrolled as a full-time sophomore or junior student in a technical field.
  • The right instincts for launching technology products, proven by prior experience and whiteboard exercises
  • Experience writing software in a programming language such as Python
  • Desire to learn quickly
  • Demonstrated capacity to communicate complex concepts clearly and simply

How To Apply
This is a paid internship/part-time role that cycles throughout the year. Applications are welcome at any time of the year.

description:
Are you passionate about building systems and software that lasts and will make an impact? Do you relish in the satisfaction of solving challenging problems? Do you want to build complex systems from the ground up? If these questions resonate with you, you’ve come to the right place!

ThoughtSpot is disrupting the Business Intelligence world in a big way and to do so, we need and welcome ideas from many areas within computer science: information retrieval, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking, security, data compression, user interface design and more.

ThoughtSpot relational search appliance brings the ease of search to enterprise data analysis. It includes a new kind of search engine, tightly integrated with large-scale, in-memory computing. The result is a consumer-class user experience combined with enterprise-class scalability while maintaining enterprise data governance and manageability for IT. We are looking for highly motivated individuals who want to make a big impact in their work.

This position is an unpaid internship. College credit is available. Our internships provide real-world experience to undergraduate and graduate-level students. As an intern, you'll have the opportunity to work on exciting projects that will empower you to learn, build, and grow.

What it takes to be a Software Engineer at ThoughtSpot:

  • Strong coding skills in modern languages such as C++/Javascript/Python
  • Strong problem solving skills, algorithmic thinking and a strong foundation in how systems work.
  • Very strong computer science fundamentals
  • Bachelor/Masters in Computer Science, PhD preferred
  • Experience in designing and developing scale-out, high-performance systems OR experience with database design OR experience in building search engines including areas such as search relevance, aggregation and indexing OR full stack/frontend development experience in building complex web/mobile applications is a plus.
  • 12 weeks are required for the internship.

Education :

  • Pursuing a degree in Computer Science or a related technical field with an expected graduation date no earlier than December 2020

About ThoughtSpot

At ThoughtSpot, we solve some of the hardest, most challenging problems in technology. The kind of problems we solve require diverse perspectives and the team-spirit to see those differences as opportunities rather than roadblocks. It’s why diversity isn’t a box to check; it’s the heart of “Selfless Excellence,” our core value we live every day. To make our dent in the universe, we seek employees with unique identities, backgrounds, and perspectives that want to build an inclusive, respectful company culture and truly challenge the status quo.

We support our employees with great benefits like 100% company paid medical/dental/vision/life coverage for employees and dependents, equity in a late stage startup backed by top-tier VCs, conveniently located Sunnyvale office with onsite gym, company-provided catered lunch and dinner, and paid holidays and flexible paid time off.

ThoughtSpot’s Search & AI-Driven analytics platform puts the power of a thousand analysts in every business person's hands. With ThoughtSpot’s next-generation analytics platform, business people can use Google-like search to easily analyze complex, large-scale enterprise data and get trusted insights to questions they didn’t know to ask, automatically - all with a single click. ThoughtSpot’s customers include the world’s largest companies, such as Amway, BT, Bed Bath and Beyond, Chevron Federal Credit Union, De Beers, JD Sports, PetCo, ServiceNow, and Scotiabank.

ThoughtSpot is helmed by CEO Sudheesh Nair after being co-founded in 2012 by Ajeet Singh and technical co-founders from Google, Microsoft, Amazon, and Oracle. Backed by investors Lightspeed Venture Partners, Khosla Ventures, General Catalyst Partners, Geodesic Capital and Capital One Growth Ventures, ThoughtSpot has raised over $550 million to date at a unicorn valuation. Join us in our mission of enabling analytics "human scale" by putting search and AI-driven analytics in the hands of 20 million users by 2020.

For more information please visit thoughtspot.com.

NanoSec is an early stage, rapidly growing startup in the San Francisco Bay area. We are now part of McAfee the largest pure play software company. It's world class team has deep expertise in innovation and product development leadership across big companies and technology startups.

We are passionate about building security products. We are building modern, elegant software that scales to thousands of nodes and work with Containers. We are building products that people love and see incredible value. We have got great momentum but there is lot of cool innovative technology to come and we want you to be part of it.

- Self starter and analytical

We are a seed-stage startup based in San Francisco, CA looking for a Business Development Intern who is motivated by powering the growth engine and enabling impact on a global scale. You’ll have the opportunity to work closely with the founders and the entirety of our small but growing team.

You can work from anywhere in the world, but if you happen to be in San Francisco, we’d love to meet you.

Our ideal candidate:
A self-starter who enjoys working in a collaborative, dynamic and fast-paced environment, who shares our customer obsession and strives to deliver the most delightful customer experience. We are looking for someone who gets excited by the opportunity to make an outsized impact by building creative products that are helping save the world. We are growing quickly and we want you to grow with us.

In this role you will be:

  • Working across every aspect of our products, helping us optimize and automate everything
  • Building and shipping crucial product features to optimize user experience
  • Working collaboratively and directly with the Founders (CEO, CTO, and COO) on strategizing and executing product roadmap
  • Brainstorming and building new products as well as tweaking aspects of our current platform

We are looking for:

  • A hustler. Someone who embodies the phrase: if there’s a will, there’s a way
  • The heart of an entrepreneur; all aspects of building a business from the ground up excite you
  • Proficiency in Python required!
  • Flask and Django experience are important
  • Javascript, React, SQL, Figma, and/or Wordpress experience strongly preferred
  • Experience working with Shopify / other e-commerce applications or Chrome / other browser extensions would be a bonus

What we will provide:

  • An opportunity to join a fast-growing startup, building products that are saving the planet
  • Learn about every aspect of building a company by working directly with founders
  • Flexible hours - get your projects done on your own time
  • A seat at the table to share your ideas and make your voice heard
  • An opportunity to be part of the team throughout the school year and/or full-time after graduation; or recommendations and introductions to anyone in our network
  • School credit (if applicable)

We look forward to chatting.

location.city: New York City • San Francisco • San Francisco Bay Area • Remote

description:
Company
Photon Commerce (www.photoncommerce.com)

Title

Software engineer

Commitment

Unpaid internship or co-op position, bonus-only. Option to go permanent, full-time. Starting as soon as possible.
Must be available for at least 25-40 hours per week.

About the company

Photon empowers fintech and eCommerce businesses with computer vision to resolve errors in supply chain invoices, and better manage supplier relationships. Photon turns paper and pdf invoices, POs, and packing slips into a modern collaboration platform for commerce, preventing problems before they become costly. Backed by the Nasdaq Entrepreneurial Center, its leadership brings experience from eCommerce and SaaS unicorns, Google AI, Amazon, and Stanford.

What you will do

• Launch React and python web apps into leading enterprise app stores having integrations
• Build a document and invoice collaboration app with embedded chat, like Slack for documents/invoices
• Deploy the app into production within 2-3 months for daily use by Fortune 500 clients

Experience

• 1+ years of experience in React, Node, Javascript, Python, SQL, AWS, and full-stack web development with work to show for it
• Knowledge in and/or passion for enterprise SaaS
• Excellent communication, critical thinking, problem-solving, and team skills

What you’ll receive

• Join an exciting, high growth startup led by serial entrepreneurs and backed by top tier Silicon Valley investors and billionaire industry leaders in tech
• Excellent performance can result in a permanent position

In your application, please start your letter with "I know Python and Javascript, and am looking to gain industry experience in an unpaid internship."
We are looking for a student who has played around with flutter before. Ideally they would have created something with the language before. Part-time.

The Celo mission is to build a financial system that creates the conditions for prosperity for everyone.

Celo aims to remove the barriers for large-scale adoption of cryptocurrencies as means-of-payment. Using a novel address-based encryption algorithm, the Celo protocol makes sending money as easy as sending a text. Additionally, Celo uses stable-value tokens pegged to fiat currencies, like the US Dollar, to minimize volatility. Celo is an open protocol enabling many to participate in the system, even with a budget Android smartphone. The first application launching on the Celo platform is a social payments and money transfer app, aimed at developing markets.

We are looking to hire interns for a fully remote, 12 week software development opportunity to assist on our Protocol and Applications Engineering teams.

About Us:

  • We are a full-stack company i.e. we are building both blockchain protocols and the user experiences on top of them
  • We are experienced startup founders and operators
  • We are highly technical, with backgrounds at places like Google and MIT
  • We are mission driven with a big goal: to bring sound currency and property rights to those who need it most
  • We have a strong engineering culture, which values open-source

You will:

  • Implement, test, and audit the stability and/or identity portion of the Celo protocol
  • Build back-end services that power our APIs
  • Help to hit product milestones by writing high quality, well tested code
  • Perform and participate in code reviews
  • Work in a high performance scrum team
  • Collaborate with product and design teams

You have:

  • A strong passion for Celo's mission
  • Ability to write high quality, well tested code
  • Strong experience developing production software
  • Strong communication skills and ability to lead technical discussions
  • Experience building software that is reusable, extensible, and modular
  • A passion for testing and achieving high test coverage

  • Enthusiasm to work in a startup environment

cLabs ("Celo Labs") started Celo in 2018 and is one of many contributors to the open source project Celo. cLabs builds financial technology to enable prosperity of all beings.

cLabs is a Teal organization, a method of decentralized management and organizational governance. Roles are defined around the work, not people, and there is a high degree of autonomy. As such, we're all proud to hold the job title of "Partner." For more information on our culture, we encourage you to check out our blog at https://medium.com/celohq/the-future-is-teal-cc264a5d51d3.

To build technology and products that are used and loved by people and solve real-world problems, we need to build a team with many different perspectives and experiences. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply and always consider qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records, in accordance with the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.

Applicants in need of special assistance or accommodation during the interview process or in accessing our website may contact us by sending an email to assistance(at)celo.org. We will treat your request as confidentially as possible. In your email, please include your name and preferred method of contact, and we will respond as soon as possible.

We’re seeking a college student to join our highly ambitious team that’s intent on building one of the next great technology companies. We’re backed by top investors from New York City and Silicon Valley, and you’ll have unparalleled opportunities to make an impact at a high-growth startup.

Responsibilities

  • Build, modify, and maintain web applications
  • Write clean, tested, and well-structured code

Minimum Requirements

  • Pursuing a BA/BS degree BA/BS in Computer Science or a related field graduating between December 2020 and December 2021
  • Experience with Java, C++, Python, Go, JavaScript, or other web programming language

Preferred Requirements

  • Familiarity with React and Node.js
  • Contribution to open source projects

Compensation

  • This is a summer internship position based in NYC with a competitive stipend.

The Role
You will be a crucial member of the core team, from building back-end infrastructure to user-facing applications — and everything in between. You will build features across the platform from user-facing web applications, workflow systems, data modeling engines, and integrations with disparate third party systems. You will help establish technical strategy and direction and will also support growing and developing a world-class engineering team. There are so many important problems to solve that directly impact the lives of the 10,000 Americans entering retirement every day.

We're looking for a software engineer intern to support our core team. As an early team member, you will have broad impact over the technology, the product, and our company's culture.

What you'll need to be successful

  • Passion and excitement for the cause: to re-define how Americans age and transition into their third chapter.
  • Deep software engineering background and proven ability to ship world-class software products.
  • Familiarity with data structures, storage systems, and front-end frameworks. Proficiency with programming languages such as Java, React, JavaScript, TypeScript or similar languages.
  • Proven ability to drive product and engineering strategy.
  • Comfort with ambiguity. While starting from a blank slate is challenging, you find it exciting, rewarding, and empowering. You are able to build products from the ground up.
  • Obsession with end-user experience.
  • Low ego.
  • First-principles thinker: we don't care how others have done things.
  • Ability to define projects and execute. Excited to set goals and be held accountable for hitting those goals.
  • Superlative positional empathy with a strong understanding of how technical decisions impact the user of what you’re building.
  • Skill and comfort working in a rapidly changing environment with dynamic objectives and iteration with users.

NavTrac is a VC-backed seed-stage stealth AI startup revolutionizing the Container Logistics industry. We have an internship opportunity with our world class engineering team!

The Role:

  • Design overall architecture of web applications
  • Collaborate with the rest of the engineering team to design and launch new features
  • Create and implement relational and non relational databases
  • Configure APIs
  • Lend support to various business and technology teams as necessary during design, development and delivery to ensure solid, scalable, robust solutions

Minimum Qualifications:
-Strong technical background. BS, MS or PhD with 3+ years of industry experience

  • Highly skilled with: Python, Ruby on Rails, Angular JS
  • Ability to build and iterate quickly. You enjoy working fast and smart, and you are comfortable in the earlier stages of developing an algorithm from scratch
  • Great communicator. You have experience writing clear, concise, and detailed documentation
  • Value complete transparency in others and ascribe to it yourself
  • Desire to hyper develop professionally

NavTrac is funded by Silicon Valley Data Capital, BootstrapLabs, Y Combinator, Kluz Ventures, FoundersX, Wharton Alumni Angels and other top silicon valley investors.

NavTrac is a VC-backed seed-stage stealth AI startup revolutionizing the Container Logistics industry. We have an internship opportunity with our world class engineering team!

Did you know that 90% of all physical good on earth are transported in containers? We are taking on the ambitious challenge of optimizing the global supply chain!

The Role:

  • Mine and analyze data from customer databases to drive optimization and improvement of product development and business strategies
  • Assess the effectiveness and accuracy of new data sources and data gathering techniques
  • Develop custom data models and algorithms to apply to data sets.
  • Use predictive modeling to increase and optimize customer experiences, revenue generation and other business outcomes

Minimum Qualifications:

  • Strong technical background. BS, MS or PhD with 2+ years of industry experience
  • Experience using statistical computer languages (R, Python, SLQ, etc.) to manipulate data and draw insights from large data sets
  • Experience working with and creating data architectures
  • Knowledge of a variety of machine learning techniques (clustering, decision tree learning, artificial neural networks, etc.) and their real-world advantages/drawbacks
  • Great communicator. You have experience writing clear, concise, and detailed documentation
  • Value complete transparency in others and ascribe to it yourself
  • Desire to hyper develop professionally

NavTrac is funded by Silicon Valley Data Capital, BootstrapLabs, Y Combinator, Kluz Ventures, FoundersX, Wharton Alumni Angels and other top silicon valley investors.

description:
OpptIn is creating a safer, quicker, online world for everyone. Through our proximity-based technology, we can turn any business or place into the infrastructure for its own personal and encrypted network. We aim to create a secure, simple way for people to network, find potential jobs, improve school efficiency, and even provide quicker access to life-saving medical test results.

OpptIn is searching for potential team members with experience in coding, design, and architecture. Any schedule works, but must be able to attend meetings that are given adequate notice for.

Website: https://www.opptin.com/internship

Team Leaders:

CEO: Howard Thomas
Project Management Lead: Hieu Vu

General Responsibilities:
• Attend regular meetings with team members, whether online or in-person
• Complete all tasks assigned to you on time
• Be able to work in a group with others
• Update the rest of the team on your progress via discord
• Be open to sharing your ideas with the rest of the team

Requirements:
• Experience with Android Studio IDE
• Experience with Java
• Experience with XML
• Experience implementing databases in Android applications preferred
• Design experience preferred
• Ability to attend meetings remotely or in-person and maintain a presence within the group, even after Proof of Concept and Alpha completion

Our team is looking for individuals interested in the healthtech space with a strong technical background. We’re currently using:

  • Swift
  • SwiftUI
  • Firebase

Applicants will use this technology.

Bloom has developed revolutionary AI that can control visual assets semantically: change people's identity, facial expression, ages, etc., in photos. Over time we will expand to entire people and scenes, in videos, to enable total control over visual content.

Our ultimate goal is to build a platform that uses this tech, along with performance data, to optimize and personalize creative assets in ads and e-commerce.

Investors include the cofounders of one of the largest stock photo companies, an AI entrepeneur with an exit to Microsoft, and tech entrepreneurs with 9-figure exits. The founder is a programmer who studied computer science at Yale and has written AI systems used by thousands of paying customers.

We are pushing forward the latest research on GANs and reinforcement learning.

We are looking for an AI intern:

  • Get your hands dirty with new programming projects being deployed to production for actual customers
  • Understand and read the latest AI research
  • Get involved in a fast-growing AI startup

About The Company

Obj-She is a community that allows everyone to have the opportunity to learn and be inspired by industry leaders in tech who want to pay back to their community. Obj-She fosters open communication and connection within the tech industry.

Objective-She's Software Engineering team is responsible for translating pixel-perfect user interfaces into a live website and mobile application that will shape the future of networking within the tech community.

As a volunteer Software Engineer, you will have the opportunity to work directly with Objective-She users from all aspects of the tech community, including CEOs, founders, influencers, investors, and Uber, Facebook, UC Davis, UC Berkeley, Carnegie Mellon alumni and more.

Fall 2020 interns with ObjShe should be available to work remotely at least 5-10 hours per week, from September 1, 2020 through December 31, 2021.

**Roles and Responsibilities

  • *the Understand basic coding fundamentals

  • Work closely with ObjShe leadership to code, deploy, and maintain front-end user interfaces using HTML5, CSS3, Javascript/jQuery

  • Provide technical design input consideration to designers on possibilities and/or technical limitations associated with webpage animation, interaction design, and/or layout design

  • Testing your implementations to eliminate browser bugs

  • Develop rich motion design for Obj-She’s websites and mobile application user interfaces

  • Perform general startup team member duties

Preferred qualifications:

• BS or equivalent degree in Computer Science or a related field, or current enrollment at a university, bootcamp, or high school AP class.

• Contribution to a live website or application, with progress documented via Github or similar service.

• Interest and ability to learn CMS such as Wordpress and HTML, CSS, JavaScript, or other technologies as needed.

• Experience communicating and solving technical challenges with a remote team of individual contributors, meeting via Zoom.

• Prior leadership experience with a sports team, academic club, or campus organization.

• Working knowledge of algorithms and data structures.

• Strong communication skills in verbal and written English.

About Sentry

Bad software is everywhere, and we’re tired of it. Sentry is on a mission to help developers write better software faster, so we can get back to enjoying technology.

With more than $67 million in funding and 20,000 customers that believe we’re on to something, we're building performance and error monitoring tools that help companies like Disney, Microsoft, and Atlassian spend less time fixing bugs and more time building products. If you like to selfishly build things that make your digital life better, come help us build the next generation of software monitoring tools.

About the Role

Software Engineering Interns at Sentry write real code on real projects that ship to production; no fetching coffee required.

In this role you will:

  • Be matched with one of our Product or Infrastructure Engineering teams, based on your interests and experience
  • Design, develop, and ship a programming solution that drives real values to customers (and if time permits, write about it on our blog)
  • Act on feedback, coaching, and mentorship from your manager and teammates

You'll love this job if:

  • You want to experience being a full-time engineer on a team and not be "just an intern"
  • You value mentorship and being able to work closely with and learn from world-class engineers
  • You want to join a modern software development team that iterates and ships code rapidly
  • You're excited at the opportunity to contribute to an open source project every day

See work that other interns have completed:

  • Implementing Sentry for Apache Beam
  • Usage Metrics for the Sentry Integration Platform
  • Error Monitoring for PySpark

Qualifications

  • Currently enrolled in an undergraduate or post-graduate degree program in Computer Science (or similar)
  • At least 1 previous internship or equivalent practical experience
  • Experience with Python, Javascript, or a similar dynamic programming language through internships, personal projects (GitHub), or coding competitions
  • You know the fundamentals of algorithms and data structures
  • Willing to relocate to SF for the duration of your internship (we'll help get you here and provide a housing stipend)

To Learn More About Sentry

  • We just raised our series C! Learn more on VentureBeat, Business Insider, and TechCrunch.
  • We're constantly writing about...us. Check out our blog here.
  • We're also tweeting away. Keep up with us on Twitter.

Sentry values diversity and inclusivity in our company and is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

description:
Are you tired of boring fintech apps? Are you interested in cryptocurrency? Do you want to learn more about the role it plays in the new economy and how to leverage that to your advantage? Apollo is creating the future of crypto trading and spearheading cryptoasset adoption by taking a user-first approach. We want to create a delightful user experience and a performant platform that makes users come back for more! We welcome passionate, intellectually curious and dedicated people looking to join our remote team. Check us out at www.apollodae.io.

Apollo interns will have the opportunity to advance their skills by making meaningful contributions to product development. Yes, that means your work will be shipped off to production! Aside from this, you will have the opportunity to learn how to trade from veteran traders and even create your own bots.

You’re an enthusiastic student or recent graduate with an interest in back end development. We care more about your desire to learn than your credentials. As an intern, you will support the development team in connecting various APIs, libraries, and creating modules in NodeJS.

These are some of your personality traits:

Reliable and an effective communicator
A strong commitment to quality and deadlines
Motivated by collaboration and love working on a team
Humble and hungry to learn skills within and beyond your domain
Desire for constant self-improvement and excellence
Keen attention to detail

Your expertise comprises the following:
JavaScript application design and testing
Creating Node.js applications
Designing and implementing webhooks and APIs (REST, SOAP, etc.)
JSON, REST, Firebase, Parse, PHP, and the like
Managing back end services and the interchange of data between the server and the users
Asynchronous I/O and NoSQL datastores such as MongoDB
MVC architecture
Unit testing and automation

Bonus points for:
