We believe that starting a business should be easier, and that hard work and careful business planning should be acknowledged, recognized, and rewarded. At Hatch, we are building software and financial products to help business owners start, plan, and grow their businesses. We started with a business line of credit with transparent and easy-to-understand terms, and can’t wait to show you what we’re building next. Hatch is a fintech startup headquartered in San Francisco, but with a remote presence all over the country.

Opportunity
As an Infrastructure Engineering Intern at Hatch, your work will have a tangible impact on our cloud platform, both in expanding its footprint and improving the way we run it. In doing so, you’ll find yourself working with both other members of the Infrastructure team and Engineering as a whole.

This is a unique opportunity to work on an agile, high functioning team, enhancing and refining everything from provisioning to monitoring. We prioritize clear communication. Ideas conceived in Slack discussions are often expounded into tech specs as necessary, which we then implement via infrastructure as code.

Cloud Platform
The Infrastructure team at Hatch makes heavy use of Terraform, Ansible, Packer and Python to manage our cloud services. All of our services run in Docker containers. CI and other repo-based automation (Terraform, Packer, Docker builds, etc.) are handled with GitHub Actions. We use Datadog for active monitoring of timeseries data. Additionally, our codebase contains a collection of small, focused command-line programs to provide an integration layer across the various open-source tools that we use.

Service reliability as a business function is critical to Hatch. In particular, the attributes of Correctness and Availability are our two primary concerns. Everything we do is conducted through that lens.

What You Can Expect
In your first month in this role, you will spend time familiarizing yourself with the platform, our tools and our processes. Expect to be doing a significant amount of work with Terraform and AWS. You will also be working on Python and shell.

In following months, you might find yourself taking on a more embedded role with backend engineering, improving both breadth and depth of application monitoring and logging. This could include writing tooling to simplify common interface use cases. Also expect to work on the next generation of provisioning and deployment here at Hatch, including working with Kubernetes and CD tools such as Spinnaker.

The Infrastructure team plans very strategically, while allowing space for reactive work as needed. This means you will have plenty of opportunity to control your destiny here at Hatch!

Skills and Experience

  • Cloud automation tools such as Terraform, Pulumi, Packer, etc.
  • Linux administration fundamentals (incl. shell programming)
  • Networking fundamentals, particularly Layer 3
  • Understanding of how web services are deployed on cloud infrastructure
  • CI/CD tools such as Jenkins, GitHub Actions, CircleCI, etc.
  • Python, with JVM experience (Kotlin, in particular) a plus

Hatch does not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.

We believe that starting a business should be easier, and that hard work and careful business planning should be acknowledged, recognized, and rewarded. At Hatch, we are building software and financial products to help business owners start, plan, and grow their businesses. We started with a business line of credit with transparent and easy-to-understand terms, and can’t wait to show you what we’re building next. Hatch is a fintech startup headquartered in San Francisco, but with a remote presence all over the country.

Opportunity
As an Android Engineering Intern at Hatch, your work will have a tangible impact on our Android app - how it looks, how it runs, and how it's built. In order to achieve your goals, you’ll find yourself working with the Android team, as well as Engineering as a whole.

This is a unique opportunity to work on an agile, high-functioning team, enhancing and refining everything from feature development to testing. We prioritize clear communication. Ideas conceived in one-off discussions will make their way into code quickly!

The Hatch Android App
The Android team (and app) is 100% Kotlin, with an eye toward how Kotlin Multi Platform will make our lives easier moving forward! We're on a standard "Square" stack of Retrofit/Moshi/Dagger/SQLDelight, with an MVVM+coroutines arch to keep things testable and agile. We use Github Actions for CI and deploy nightly to our internal testers.

What You Can Expect
In your first week, you'll onboard onto the app, architecture, and any unfamiliar tech (e.g. coroutines, ViewModel). In your first month, you'll have shipped a number of features and bugfixes, and maybe spent some time investigating slicker CI tooling or Gradle scripts.

In following months, you might find yourself taking on a more weighty projects, owning entire user flows, refactoring cruft, adding better tests, analytics, or monitoring -- things a full-time engineer would do! We're a small team, and we'll encourage you to try new libraries or frameworks! You might even write some backend code, since our backend in 100% Kotlin as well.

Thee Android team has good line-of-sight on priorities, and there's plenty of work to go around. You'll join a small-but-nimble team and come away with a wealth of knowledge, all while helping us build a great app!

Skills & Experience

  • A good grasp of programming fundamentals -- but we don't care if you can reverse a binary tree.
  • Experience with Kotlin (or Java ☕️ ), Android Studio, JUnit, and some subset of: Dagger, Moshi, SQLDelight, Coroutines, Jetpack Navigation, or Kotlin Multiplatform.
  • Experience creating readable, well-crafted, and maintainable code﻿﻿
  • Ability to work and thrive in a small group: strong communication, collaboration, and empathy.
  • Resourcefulness and comfort with ambiguity: we won't know the answers to everything, but we'll figure it out together!
  • If nothing else, good Google-fu and StackOverflow reading ability. We’d love to have you apply, even if you feel unsure about whether you meet every single requirement in this posting. (Since this is an internship, we generally expect you to be enrolled in a program seeking a bachelor's or master's degree. If this is not the case for you, please include a note with your circumstances)

Hatch does not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.

Position Overview

As a Software Engineer, Intern, you'll have the opportunity to spend 12 weeks working on one (or more) of the engineering teams at MemSQL. As an intern, you will be at the forefront of real-time technology that’s revolutionizing how companies run their businesses everyday. With release cycles throughout the year, our engineers are accustomed to moving quickly in a rapid production environment. To do this successfully, we work collaboratively and creatively across teams to maximize our opportunity for impact. We also believe it’s important to celebrate our wins together whether it be at local spot or getting out of the city for some exploring.

As a Software Engineer, Intern, you will be empowered to own your projects end-to-end and be an active contributor throughout the product life cycle. To expedite your growth path, you will partner with engineers who deeply care about your success and will lend their expertise to your professional development. Our engineers are not just technical partners/mentors, but are also business partners who are exposed to all areas of the business, working with teams such as product, marketing, and sales.

Role and Responsibilities

Our Software Engineers work on small, collaborative teams to help drive our company forward. Whether you’re building new features in Javascript and React.js, increasing the runtime and performance of a MemSQL cluster, or writing new C++ code for the query optimizer, our University Graduates are responsible for brand new and existing projects that are deployed into production with each release. Your work will include everything from writing to testing software, and you’ll gain a significant understanding of both the product and the business.

Required Skills and Experience

  • Enrolled in a B.S. Degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, or related discipline
  • Deep understanding of C.S. fundamentals
  • Strong programming skills with Python, Go, C, C++, or JavaScript
  • Passionate about building highly reliable software
  • Firm grasp of algorithms and data structures

MemSQL is The No-Limits Database™ powering modern applications and analytical systems with a cloud-native, scalable architecture for maximum ingest and query performance at the highest concurrency. MemSQL envisions a world where every business can make decisions in real time and every experience is optimized through data.

Global enterprises use the MemSQL distributed database to easily ingest, process, analyze, and act on data in order to thrive in today’s insight-driven economy. MemSQL is optimized to run on any public cloud or on-premises with commodity hardware. Visit memsql.com or follow us @memsql.

Consistent with our commitment to diversity & inclusion, we value individuals with the ability to work on diverse teams and with a diverse range of people.

To all recruitment agencies: MemSQL does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to MemSQL employees. MemSQL is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes and will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with the Company.

Ensemble Energy is an exciting startup in industrial IoT space focused on energy. Our mission is to accelerate the clean energy revolution by making it more competitive using the power of data. Ensemble’s AI enabled SaaS platform provides prescriptive analytics to power plant operators by combining the power of machine learning, big data, and deep domain expertise. As a data engineering intern, you will be participating in developing and deploying fault-tolerant ETL pipelines, perform data visualization and enable the development of ML algorithms.

Required Skills & Experience:

- React/Redux, HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, Python, Django and REST API’s
- Current BS or MS student or recent graduate. CS major is a plus
- Strong foundation in Computer Science, with deep knowledge of data structures, algorithms, and software design
- Experience with GIT, CI/CD tools, Atlassian software, AWS CodeDeploy, Lambda, Serverless a plus
- Experience with Elasticsearch/ELK stack a plus
- Contribute with ideas to overall product strategy and roadmap
- Self-starter to take ownership of the platform engineering and application development
- Work on multiple projects simultaneously and get things done. Take products from prototype to production
- Collaborate with other team members for continuous development

Preferred:

- Ability to stay-on for part-time or full-time as a co-op until May 2020
- Ability to demonstrate a portfolio of projects (GitHub, papers, etc.)

Bonus - If you have worked on one or more below then highlight those projects when applying:

- Experience with Time Series DB - M3DB, Prometheus, InfluxDB, OpenTSDB, ELK Stack
- Experience with visualization tools like Tableau, KeplerGL etc.
- Experience with AWS IoT Core, Greengrass, MQTT or other IoT communication protocols a plus

Ensemble’s AI enabled SaaS platform provides prescriptive analytics to power plant operators by combining the power of machine learning, big data, and deep domain expertise. As a data engineering intern, you will be participating in developing and deploying fault-tolerant ETL pipelines, perform data visualization and enable the development of ML algorithms.

Required Skills & Experience:
• Currently enrolled or recently graduated with MS or PhD in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Statistics, or equivalent fields. Specialization in data engineering preferred.
• Strong understanding of data engineering principles using big data technologies
• Expertise in relational databases (MSSQL/MySQL/Postgres) and expertise in SQL. Exposure to NoSQL such as Cassandra. MongoDB will be a plus.
• Experience with distributed computing using Hadoop and Spark
• Exposure to deploying ETL pipelines such as AirFlow, AWS Data Pipeline, AWS Glue
• Excellent programming skills in Java, Scala or Python. Python is preferred

Preferred:

• Ability to demonstrate a portfolio of projects (GitHub, papers, etc.)

The most important requirement is a can-do attitude and desire to make a change. Come join an exciting startup that is working on immense technical challenges and a mission to do our part to fight climate change.

position: Gabb Global Unity Game Developer Intern
description:
Company Description

Gabb Global is devoted to creating a comfortable and cutting-edge method of language learning. Our immersive virtual reality, gaming format are personalized to offer refreshing, unforgettable language learning experiences. Gamification, technology, and innovation are paramount to engaging today's learners and enabling sufficient content mastery. My start up, Gabb, takes the foundations of neuroscience, a language curriculum tailored to user interests/purpose, and filter foreign language through real-world learning scenarios, and powerful learning dynamic of gamification (aka what makes games fun!): escape, collection, discovery, pattern recognition, and other risk/reward activities. We masterfully integrated elements of gamification to engage, inspire, and improve user’s conversation, writing, speaking, and listening skills. Our we focus on gamification as a design sensibility.We are looking for a talented Game developer to turn a game idea into code on a fast moving environment. You will be involved in various aspects of game’s creation from concept to finished product including coding, programming, audio, design, production and visual arts. As a Gabb Global Gaming Development Intern, you are helping us constantly break new ground with graphically rich mobile games, fun new genres of mobile entertainment, and innovative technologies


Responsibilities

Implement game functionality as per communicated design
Translate design specification into functional game
Communicate with other team members to establish effective pipeline and integrate media assets
Design, build, and maintain efficient, reusable, and reliable code
Ensure the best possible performance, quality, and responsiveness of applications
Identify bottlenecks and bugs, and devise solutions to address and mitigate these problems
Help maintain code quality, organization, and automatization

Skills

Excellent knowledge of Unity, including experience with scripting, textures, animation, GUI styles, and user session management
Familiarity with level design and planning
Experience with game physics and particle systems
Experience with mobile and console game development
Experience optimizing memory and space usage for support of older hardware
Experience with 3D is a plus
Prior experience with a well-known mobile title or AAA titles are a significant asset

The Chief Learning Officer (CLO) serves as a member of senior management and plans, directs, and evaluates the SDMS strategic initiatives in professional development and life‐long learning programs. The CLO is responsible for the identification, development, and implementation of scientific methods, instructional strategies, and learning technologies in the design, implementation, and evaluation of

our learning tools. Ideally, this candidate has a connection to a university where we can pilot our games and virtual reality experiences.

DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES

This is not a complete list of this position’s duties and responsibilities. The items below are examples of
the types of activities performed. Other duties may be assigned.

  • Lead a team accountable for overall planning, implementation, and effectiveness of professional
    development strategies and initiatives, including the SDMS Annual Conference
  • Oversee and direct all activities related to planning, development, implementation, and evaluation
    of professional development strategies and initiatives targeting sonographers and other healthcare
    providers
  • Collaborate with the Marketing and Communications Department to promote professional
    development activities
  • Establish high levels of quality, accuracy, and process consistency
  • Ensure ongoing compliance and maintenance of the SDMS CME Policies and Procedures and other
    external requirements and guidelines
     Establish, direct, and maintain a learning management system that ensures effective learning
    outcomes
     Maintain status as an approved continuing medical education (CME) provider with national
    certification/credentialing organizations
     Identify changes in the learning and professional development environments and evaluate and adjust the departmental plans and processes accordingly  Oversee the learning section of the website  Foster a culture and framework of innovation and excellence
     Develop, implement, and evaluate the departmental budget
    Position Description: Chief Learning Officer Page 2
     Collaborate with senior staff on various strategic initiatives  Serve as staff liaison to assigned committees, task forces, and volunteers
     Identify and implement new technologies and methodologies
    QUALIFICATIONS
    EDUCATION/CERTIFICATIONS/LICENSES
     Master’s degree in relevant field; Doctoral preferred
     Certified Association Executive (CAE) preferred
    SKILLS & EXPERIENCE
     At least 10 years progressive experience in adult learning and elearning
     At least 5 of the years in a strategic leadership role
     Experience with accreditation and certification organization criteria, policies, standards, and processes
     Data driven, systems thinker who can generate and execute ideas at strategic and tactical levels
     Thrives in a fast‐paced environment, integrating disparate activities, new technologies, and agendas while adhering to deadlines and budgets  Instinctive collaborator with strong staff management experience who values teamwork and the input of others
     Creative visionary with a passion for learning and professional development and the ability to
    clearly articulate ideas and concepts
     Strong analytical and problem solving skills with the ability to understand the big picture
     Experience working with and providing strategic direction to volunteers
     Strong computer skills including Microsoft Office applications; Internet and technology savvy
     Experience with contract negotiations

position: Gabb Global Front End Developer Intern
description:
We believe that virtual reality and specifically the new generation of stand alone units provide the opportunity to learn a new language in an immersive spatial context that has never been possible before. We are now starting our VR team. You will work closely with Gabb Global Language Experience team, who are experts in teaching languages. Together, we're building an immersive virtual setting that will allow students to acquire and retain vocabulary and grammar more intuitively and efficiently than previously possible.

We are creating a virtual reality language learning experience to help users learning Spanish. We are also creating a virtual reality experience for English learners in US schools across the country. If you are interested in this job, you will recreate and experience that we already have for MR, and make it compatible for Oculus Rift/ Quest, and other VR platfroms. You will be working directly with our designers as well.

We are looking for a qualified Front-end developer to join our IT team. You will be responsible for building the ‘client-side’ of our web applications. You should be able to translate our company and customer needs into functional and appealing interactive applications.

If you’re interested in creating a user-friendly environment by writing code and moving forward in your career, then this job is for you. We expect you to be a tech-savvy professional, who is curious about new digital technologies and aspires to combine usability with visual design.

Ultimately, you should be able to create a functional and attractive digital environment for our company, ensuring great user experience.

Responsibilities
Use markup languages like HTML to create user-friendly web pages
Maintain and improve website
Optimize applications for maximum speed
Design mobile-based features
Collaborate with back-end developers and web designers to improve usability
Get feedback from, and build solutions for, users and customers
Write functional requirement documents and guides
Create quality mockups and prototypes
Help back-end developers with coding and troubleshooting
Ensure high quality graphic standards and brand consistency
Stay up-to-date on emerging technologies
Requirements
Proven work experience as a Front-end developer
Hands on experience with markup languages
Experience with JavaScript, CSS and jQuery
Familiarity with browser testing and debugging
In-depth understanding of the entire web development process (design, development and deployment)
Understanding of layout aesthetics
Knowledge of SEO principles
Familiarity with software like Adobe Suite, Photoshop and content management systems
An ability to perform well in a fast-paced environment
Excellent analytical and multitasking skills
BSc degree in Computer Science or relevant field

U.S. CITIZENSHIP OR GREEN CARD REQUIRED
(Note: This is due to U.S. export regulations, and we are unable to make exceptions.)

Four billion people do not have access to the internet. Astranis is going to change that. We are building the next generation of smaller, lower-cost telecommunications satellites to bring the world online.

Come work with incredibly smart people who have flown things in space before. No prior space experience needed, you just need to enjoy getting your hands dirty with real hardware and be okay with struggling to do things that seem impossibly hard.

We’re a well-funded team of over 100 world-class engineers that move fast. We raised our Series B ($90M) from Andreessen Horowitz and Venrock, launched our first satellite in 2018, secured our first major customer deal in 2019, and we’ll triple the satellite internet capacity of Alaska in 2021.

Our mission and our products are meant to connect the world and everyone in it, regardless of gender, race, creed, or any other distinction. We believe in a diverse and inclusive workplace, and we encourage all people to join our team and bring their unique perspective to help make us stronger.

Role

  • Design signal processing for custom software defined radio hardware (ex. channelization, equalization, PA linearization, gain control, carrier synchronization, symbol mapping, framing, channel coding/FEC, etc)
  • Work closely with FPGA developers to implement and test the signal processing on radio hardware
  • Model the end-to-end radio system from earth to space, and back.
  • Drive radio architecture trade studies, run link budgets, optimize the radio system for maximum performance for dozens of markets and use cases around the world

Requirements

  • Bachelor of Science degree in electrical engineering or equivalent
  • A passion for working in a fast-paced environment and constantly learning
  • Strong fundamentals in "signals and systems" (basic transforms, filters, aliasing, analysis in both continuous and discrete domains, interpolation, decimation, etc)
  • Strong fundamentals in digital communications (modulation, coding, synchronization, fading, doppler, multiple access, channel capacity, etc)
  • Familiar with software development (some experience writing software for DSP, MCU, and/or FPGA, experience in one or more scripting languages)
  • Familiar with analog concepts (amplifiers, analog filters, gain and delay variation, reflections, compression, etc)
  • Experience working with signal generator, signal analyzer, network analyzer, oscilloscope, etc
  • US Citizenship or Green Card

Bonus

  • Experience with software defined radios
  • Experience with Python
  • Experience with GNU Radio
  • Experience with FPGA development (and/or embedded C)

U.S. CITIZENSHIP OR GREEN CARD REQUIRED
(Note: This is due to U.S. export regulations, and we are unable to make exceptions.)

Four billion people do not have access to the internet. Astranis is going to change that. We are building the next generation of smaller, lower-cost telecommunications satellites to bring the world online.

Come work with incredibly smart people who have flown things in space before. No prior space experience needed, you just need to enjoy getting your hands dirty with real hardware and be okay with struggling to do things that seem impossibly hard.

We’re a well-funded team of over 100 world-class engineers that move fast. We raised our Series B ($90M) from Andreessen Horowitz and Venrock, launched our first satellite in 2018, secured our first major customer deal in 2019, and we’ll triple the satellite internet capacity of Alaska in 2021.

Our mission and our products are meant to connect the world and everyone in it, regardless of gender, race, creed, or any other distinction. We believe in a diverse and inclusive workplace, and we encourage all people to join our team and bring their unique perspective to help make us stronger.

Role

  • RTL Development for FPGA targeted applications
  • Work with multiple FPGAs and toolchains
  • Interface FPGAs with a variety of peripherals including high speed data converters, memories, MCUs
  • Write software to interface and test RTL in hardware
  • Collaborate closely with electrical and software engineers

Requirements

  • US Citizenship or Green Card (This is a legal requirement; no exceptions)
  • Currently pursuing a B.S. or M.S. in electrical engineering, computer science, computer engineering, or equivalent
  • A passion for hardware development, including working in a fast-paced environment and hands-on design and development
  • Experience in designing, implementing, and testing high throughput systems implemented on FPGAs
  • Proficiency with Verilog/SystemVerilog for synthesis

Bonus

  • Experience with UVM and advanced SystemVerilog verification
  • Experience with Xilinx FPGAs
  • Experience with Vivado IDE, TCL
  • Familiarity with system level estimates and implications of power, thermal, and real estate
  • Experience with high speed data converters (ADCs, DACs, JESD204B)
  • Experience with circuit level debugging
  • Experience with digital communication theory and implementation, such as LDPC implementations
  • Experience with space-based systems
  • Experience with modern communication systems (RF, IF/IQ, time/freq domains, modulation)
  • Experience in at least 1 domain beyond logic design. This could be DSP/radio design, software, hi-rel design (e.g. fault analysis & recover), etc.

The Basics:

Tanium is looking for a curious, driven, and hardworking individual to join its Value Engineering team as a 2021 Summer Intern. This role will interact with various teams and levels of management, and the right candidate must have the ability to communicate at multiple levels across the Sales team. This person must be an analytical and critical thinker, a problem solver, data-oriented, and a clear communicator. She/he must be able to roll-up their sleeves, and work directly with financial models and data. The ideal candidate is detail-oriented, independent, confident speaking to a group, and naturally inquisitive.

The position can be located anywhere in the continental United States.

What you’ll do:

  • Work with the Director of Value Engineering on various initiatives designed to help our sales teams better forecast and communicate the value of the Tanium platform to our customers
  • Define ways to simply, streamline and/or automate current processes, in order to drive greater efficiency of the Value Engineering function as Tanium grows
  • Curate and mine the various models we’ve built over the past 5+ years to find insights and opportunities

We’re looking for someone with:

  • Bachelor’s Degree candidate, majoring in Economics, Mathematics, Statistics, Business Administration, Finance or Accounting
  • 2-3 years of college or university classes/credits
  • Proficiency in Excel/Google Sheets, PowerPoint/Google Slides required
  • Solid understanding of financial concepts as they apply to the evaluation, selection and purchase of information technology (e.g. business cases/cost-benefit analysis, return on investment, total cost of ownership, productivity impact, etc.)
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills, including presenting to executives and large groups

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience working within a high-growth, technology company, particularly in the software industry
  • Experience partnering directly with leaders at the Director level and above
  • Experience with Microsoft SharePoint, OneDrive, Teams

About Tanium:

At Tanium, we offer a proven platform for endpoint visibility and control that transforms how the world's largest and most sophisticated organizations manage and secure their computing devices with unparalleled speed and agility. There’s a reason why more than half of the Fortune 100, top retailers and financial institutions, and four branches of the US Armed Forces rely on Tanium.

Our unstoppable spirit, drive to do the right thing and win as a team attitude has earned us the rank of 7th on the Forbes list of “Top 100 Private Companies in Cloud Computing” for 2019 and 10th on FORTUNE’s list of the “100 Best Medium Workplaces.”

At Tanium, we take care of our employees and their communities with things like 5 days of Volunteer Time Off.

TapTab is a cutting-edge mobile application that is creating the future of the dining experience, and we’re looking for great people who are excited about that future.

We are seeking Frontend Engineering Interns to join our frontend web development team. Our summer internship program runs from September 21 - December 11, 2020. As a Frontend Engineering Intern, you will work on frontend web development tasks. Specific assignments will vary depending upon your interests and skills.

This is an excellent opportunity to participate in an exciting, emerging startup at an early stage; learn from a fun, friendly and highly-motivated team of developers; gain valuable work experience; and enhance your resume for future opportunities.

RESPONSIBILITIES

Your responsibilities will be to:

• Work with TapTab engineers on innovative web applications
• Research, select, test and contribute to the adoption of software architecture, programming languages and new technologies
• Test and document code, and ensure code quality, reliability and optimal performance

QUALIFICATIONS

• Recent Sofware Engineering Bootcamp graduate OR full-time undergraduate or graduate student in Computer Science or related field at an accredited college or university
• 3.0 GPA or higher
• Proficiency in and experience with front end programming languages, specifically React.js, HTML5, CSS3 and JavaScript
• Interest in developing scalable, adaptive, high-performance apps
• Ability to write and test high-quality, readable, reliable and well-architected code
• Ability to define, understand, develop, test and iterate new product features
• Experience with markup languages
• Familiarity with Git version control
• Located in or willing to work in New York City
• Strong written and verbal communication skills

BONUS SKILLS & QUALITIES

• Deep interest in software development and knowledge of latest technological developments
• Knowledge of backend development using Node.js
• Interest in startups

The Frontend Engineering Intern position is a unpaid role, and the intern is not considered an employee for wage purposes and shall not receive employee benefits, such as health or dental insurance, or pension or retirement credit. Participation in the internship does not guarantee the intern a job at the conclusion of the internship.

Applicants who receive college/university credit for internships are strongly encouraged to apply. And TapTab is happy to work with your educational institution to help you earn credit for your internship.

TapTab is a cutting-edge mobile application that is inventing the future of the dining experience, and we’re looking for great people who are excited about that future.

We are looking to hire Software Development tech lead interns for managing the product lifecycle and tech interns working on the products we are building for venture capital and private equity markets. It is a great opportunity for people looking to make their careers as a team lead/product manager in product based tech companies.. We understand that the role does not offer much in terms of monetary compensation but is a great way to kickstart your career in product management and full stack software development. It is also a great opportunity to learn product management and state of the art full stack web development skills.

The tech lead should be able to join us at least for 2 months and should be willing to commit 2-3 hours of dedicated development time on a daily basis along with 1-2 hours of project management tasks. You’ll have a chance to push your code to production within a week of joining the team. Interested candidates should include their CV (and past work samples).

Culture

Our team is completely remote with team members based in Japan, India and Canada. We are a company working in the space of Venture Capital and Private Equity focusing on startups from emerging markets and are (primarily) catered towards Japanese investors and companies (we don’t mind working with global players either)

Tech Stack:

Our tech stack is written in:

  • ReactJS for Frontend
  • NodeJS/Flask for backend (depending on which tech product team you join)
  • Cloud hosted MongoDB for database
  • Github for issue and project management
  • AWS (Amazon Web Services) for Deployment

Ideal Candidate

An ideal candidate should have decent knowledge of concepts above and willingness to learn. We value commitment and dedication over past experience. The candidate should be able to manage people reporting to him/her and should be able to take ownership of the tech product they are working on.

Software Development Methodology

We follow lean startup methodology and value iterative development over full-on product development cycles. We incorporate agile methodologies into development (we are not onto the stage for sprint planning YET). We follow continuous integration development style for deploying code.

About Investocracy:

Investocracy (https://www.investocracy.co/) is one of a kind startup and investment deal discovery platform focused on connecting startups from Africa and other emerging markets and is targeted towards Japanese investors and companies. We also operate a bi-lingual (English and Japanese) news and media platform invc.news catering to global startup information and updates. The company founder is an alumnus from IIT Kanpur, India.

We offer the following services:

  • Consulting services into raising funding, especially from Japan
  • Startup incubation service under our umbrella (currently work in progress)
  • Tech platform to connect founders and investors for pitch practice
  • Market research and custom made venture capital reports
  • Startup and Investor Networking Events
  • News and Media website (https://www.invc.news/) covering exclusive interviews with founders, funding related news, resources for entrepreneurs
  • Top startup and venture capital lists for a particular domain (example MedTech) in a particular geography (example: Singapore)

Our purpose is simple: Provide Information Democracy for global investments.

description:
Joatu is an open source Ruby on Rails community-building platform designed, developed, and maintained by a team of dedicated volunteers. Our platform is designed to help people become engaged and empowered citizens by providing them with opportunities to use their skills to build more resilient communities.

We are looking for community-oriented full-stack developers to join our team and help expand our community empowerment platform. The ideal candidate will be able contribute at least 10 hours per month to the project. Previous experience with Ruby on Rails is an asset, but not required.

Don't hesitate to contact us if you have any questions.

---

Learn more about Joatu:

- We are currently applying to become a Benefit Corporation (B-Corp).

- Recent winner of the Cooperathon 2017 in the Smart & Inclusive City category.

As a user, you can create a local event that brings value to the community. Does that look like a park cleanup? A community garden? An alleyway concert? A puppet show? A potluck for the hungry? It's up to you! And each of these activities generate Community Action Points (CAPS) for their volunteers.

With these CAPS, you can exchange them with other members on the platform for their goods and services, and with some local businesses who also want to be supportive of local community actions.

We also publicise the freely accessible local spaces like libraries and community centres so that you have places to host your local events more readily.

Resolve is a social media app (in development) where users can put up monetary incentives called "bounties" to get things done online. On Resolve you will be able to turn your dollars directly into the actions of others. Resolve supports free market competitive forces for efficiency, but is run with the intent of improving the world and the people in it. Our company culture is one that celebrates productivity for the sake of positivity. If you would like to work for Resolve you will need to see the value in both!

As an intern, you will have a significant and meaningful role in the development of the prototype Resolve Android application. You will be working side-by-side with the Founders of the company to help build the beta version of the app. There is an opportunity for full-time employment (with equity compensation) if you prove to be a valuable team member.

What will you be doing?

1. Working closely within your team of interns while taking guidance from the Co-Founders.

2. Turning mock-ups and text descriptions of pages/features into functioning code on an Android mobile app.

3. Developing an algorithm to rank posts in a user's feed based on which users they are following and which topics they are interested in.

4. Learning on-the-job to do tasks you may not have experience with. The app will be made from the ground up and while working at a startup, you must wear many hats.

You don't have to be skilled in all of the above, since we will be recruiting team members with complementary skills. If you believe in Resolve and are willing to work hard we encourage you to apply. If you are interested in working for Resolve you may fill out the online application form here: goo.gl/forms/D1jRsgiFxPPYMLGm2

Developer's Website: resolvedevs.com

Preferred Skills

Java
Android Studio
Comfortable with object-oriented programming & APIs

Our platform enables retailers and sellers on P2P marketplaces (Craigslist, Facebook Marketplace, OfferUp, Craigslist, eBay, etc.) to "level up" with a suite of tools that lets them sell anything, everywhere. Our channel manager allows seamless cross-posting, renewals, and de-listing, and our inventory management and communications tools help sellers increase revenue and maximize sale velocity.

We have been accepted to a prestigious accelerator and are currently focusing on an aggressive development cycle, so we can beta test/ship our product and bring it to market in the coming weeks,.

We have an immediate opening for a front-end development intern to translate UX/UI wireframes into functional code for the various pages on our developing platform. The ideal candidate should be a passionate coder and developer, a self-starter, efficient in both autonomous and collaborative environments, and be receptive to feedback. Personal accountability, accountability to the team, and ability to work effectively under deadlines are essential.

We are open to both students and professionals (If you are an experienced professional that has been furloughed or laid off due to coronavirus and want to ensure continuity on your resume and LinkedIn profile, or if you're looking to boost your portfolio, @ us!).

We are happy to consider remote candidates (our entire team is currently remote due to Covid-19), and while this internship is unpaid, we are happy to work with you and your academic institution to ensure that you receive academic credit, where applicable.

Responsibilities:
• Translation of UI/UX design into effective and functional code
• Use of markup languages such as HTML to create user-friendly web pages
• Collaboration with lead backend developer to ensure (and improve) usability
• Application optimization for maximum speed
• Creation of reusable and reliable code and libraries for future use

Qualifications:
• Experience with JavaScript, CSS, node.js, React.js, and jQuery
• Proficient understanding of client-side scripting and JavaScript frameworks (including jQuery)
• Strong proficiency with HTML, CSS

Job Type: Internship, 3-6 months, with possibility to renew
Internship Compensation: College Credit, Unpaid
Schedule: Monday to Friday (Flexible)

Please include a brief cover note (a sentence or two is fine) letting us know why you're interested in ListAcross, and please include a link to relevant work/your portfolio and LinkedIn profile.

No recruiters
Please keep all communication and applications on Angel.co
Please do not reach out via LinkedIn

We are looking to hire a new Research Intern to help with the non-profit side of the company and our Deepfake Detection research.

You’d help create AI-first products -- implement state-of-the-art research papers, contribute to the company IP, and technology stack deployed at scale.

You’d work on cutting-edge deep learning, and computer vision problems with an emphasis on deep fake detection and adversarial methods, with an opportunity to collaborate with research scientists and engineers at the AI Foundation and its partnering institutions.

Candidates should have:
Experience (academic or industry) with Computer Vision and Deep Learning in at least two of:
- Neural networks - CNNs, RNNs, autoencoders, etc., and transfer learning
- Generative deep learning method, esp. for image generation
- Neural Rendering
- Image forensics and processing

Additional Items:

    • Team player with a positive attitude, mindful, with good communication skills.

We offer a competitive hourly rate and the chance to work with a world-class AI research and engineering team using state of the art and future-looking AI/ML techniques.

AI Foundation is a hybrid for-profit and non-profit working on advancing the science and application of AI-based generation technologies.

AI Foundation is committed to a culture of flexibility, diversity, and fun for all of our employees. We are working on some of the most challenging technical problems and we know the solutions will come from all of us working together in an inclusive, transparent and open manner.

Pocket Gems seeks to build the greatest games and most compelling interactive entertainment in the world. That’s the mission our founders began with in an apartment above a pizza shop back in 2009 and it continues to inspire us today. Since then, we’ve grown to over 200 people in San Francisco, and with $155 million in backing from Sequoia Capital and Tencent, we’re constantly breaking new ground in mobile entertainment.

Our products have been downloaded over 450 million times by players around the world. In recent years, we’ve launched Episode, a mobile storytelling network and platform, and War Dragons, a visually stunning 3D real-time strategy game.

As our community of players continues to grow, we’re committed to building diverse and inclusive environments across our teams, and in our games.

As a summer Software Engineer Intern, you will be a part of a small intern cohort, paired with an experienced software engineering mentor, collaborating cross-functionally with teams including other software engineers, product managers, artists, and designers to define our next generation of mobile games. During our 10-week program, our interns are meaningful contributors to our live products, leaving the summer having made a tangible impact on their team while gaining technical and professional skills to set them up for future success!

**Please note that we intend to host the internship in person (San Francisco, CA), but we are prepared to host virtually if the conditions are unsafe to return to the office.*

  • Develop and code innovative features using groundbreaking technologies
  • Enjoy the freedom of writing native applications while exploring the latest cross-platform technologies
  • Participate in all aspects of the project life-cycle, from ideation to specification to release
  • Design and implement scalable, reliable and maintainable technologies for our iOS and Android gaming platforms
  • Work with innovative, great, fun people!

What You Bring to the Engineering Team:

  • Working toward a BA, BS, or MS in Computer Science or related technical discipline
  • Solid foundation in computer science, with strong competencies in data structures, algorithms, software design and OOP
  • Passion and excitement for solving interesting problems and building great products!

Extra Gems For:

  • Programming experience in one or more of the following: C/C++, C#, Objective-C, Java, Python, JavaScript, Mobile Software Development (iOS, Android)

Other Internship Perks:

  • An amazing summer packed with mentorship, networking opportunities, learning & development roundtables, fun intern events (escape room, intern olympics, jackbox), and of course projects with real business impact.
  • Read more about what we’ve been up to here!

Please Note:

  • We are looking for students going to U.S. universities, graduating in Winter 2021 or Spring 2022
  • Prior mobile/gaming experience is NOT required

Looking for a software engineering intern who has experience in Reactjs, Nodejs, GraphQL and python. Please note that this is unpaid internship position.

We're developing a mechatronic device to help the personal care products retail industry deal with some of the challenges that Covid has brought to the industry, and we're looking a mechatronics intern to assist in bringing the device from a prototype to a consumer ready product to be launched in Fall 2020.

The device combines a tablet as the UI, an Arduino as the microcontroller (firmware is written in C), a plastic internal structure fabricated using a 3D printer, and a few standard mechanical components.

As part of the internship, you will be involved in 1) making changes to the device's design in CAD, 2) fabricating (or finding a supplier to fabricate) the device's internal and external structure, 3) maintaining the machine’s electronics system, 4) ensuring that the communication between the server and Arduino is stable, as well as other things that pop up in finishing the product.

We’re looking for someone who has a mechatronics skill set (including CAD, PCB design, Arduino, 3D printing, motors, etc…), is detail oriented, a self starter, and is interested in building beautiful consumer facing products.

The role will be 15 – 25 hours/week for the Fall semester, and will be unpaid. It will also be mostly remote, though there will be some need to work with other engineers wherever the prototype is located in the NYC area (given Covid, we'll have to figure out how to do that safely).

Ideally, if the internship goes well from both our sides, we would like bring on the candidate in a part time equity position after the internship ends (and if the company grows we’d love for it to turn into a full time position), but if you are just interested in a Fall internship and not necessarily joining the company, that’s fine too!

We're a stealth mode startup developing a hardware/software solution to address the challenges that the personal care industry is facing as a result of Covid 19.

We've developed a V1 prototype of our product, and are looking for a software engineering intern to finish the product's software development to be launched in Fall 2020.

The product works in two ways. It accepts orders from a web app on the tablet of our product, or it can accept orders by scanning a QR code on the tablet and using the web app that pops up on your phone to place the order. We fulfill customers orders by having the web app communicate directly with an arduino, so this type of experience would be a major plus.

The role's responsibiltiies are as follows:

  • Build product's software component
  • Integrate software into overall hardware product

Desired skills:

  • Experience with NodeJS
  • Experience with ReactJS
  • Experience integrating payment processor into app
  • IoT integration
  • Full stack web app development (design is really simple)
  • API dev

The internship is unpaid, will last around 2 months, and will require around 15-20 hours work/week. Ideally, if the internship goes well from both our sides, we would like bring on the candidate in a part time equity position after the internship ends (and if the company grows we’d love for it to turn into a full time position), but if you are just interested in an internship and not necessarily joining the company, that’s fine too.

position: Web Development Intern – Work on new challenges while learning new skills
description:
Who we are.

Part consulting group; part startup accelerator we are a startup of startups. Our goal is to build a team that can quickly find the valuation of any idea and help bring it to market in an efficient low-cost manner. This may include software development, UX/UI design, marketing or a number of other skills. Whether it's a client company or an internal idea we have what it takes to make it successful.

We’re looking for a co-founder to join the team and lead a team of senior developers and interns, help with product development and become part of the face of the company.

The ideal candidate is an experienced engineer who is comfortable in both large and small environments. Someone who understands leadership and organizational philosophy and most importantly is still hungry to build companies. So far it's been a fun idea and we're optimistic about success across multiple areas.

Benefits of working with us:
• Enhance your skillset and knowledge
• Opportunity to learn about many different verticals
• Feel empowered and change things - We value ideas and suggestions
• Work in an inclusive culture where transparency, creativity, accountability and ownership are encouraged
• Freedom to take out-of-the-box approach
• Support and resources to grow into a senior management position
• Flat Organization structure
• Exposure to startup challenges

Who you Are
• People tell you that you have a high attention to detail
• You are a bottom-up thinker, and are wholly unsatisfied with a functional solution that you do not understand
• You write clean, readable, testable and maintainable code
• You love working with other people, and people love working with you

Skills

• Front end development experience, using at least one major client side framework (React, Angular, Vue, etc)
• API development experience, using at least one major server side framework (Django, Rails, Node/Express, etc.)
• Experience using a variety of database technologies (SQL, NoSQL, key-value stores, etc.), and familiar with the tradeoffs and use cases for each

Bonus Skills
• Familiarity with React Native, Firebase/Firestore, GraphQL/Apollo, Docker/Kubernetes, and/or streaming content analytics would be considered a strong plus
• You have solid software engineering fundamentals:
o You understand unit/integration/system testing, and have a practical understanding of when each is necessary
o You have good software design skills, and know how to apply separation of concerns, inversion of control, dependency injection, etc.

Together, we can impact mental health on a global scale, and if you're ready to create groundbreaking technology in Emotion AI, we invite you to apply for our Machine Learning Internship role based in San Francisco where you'll get to build a world-class set of machine learning applications to scale across homes, offices, and commutes globally.

Emotion AI is a complex problem and emotional response is not trivial. In order to build an emotion estimation model, we will need to annotate various signal data. We will need to build supervised and unsupervised models and look at model performance and latency, address issues with bias, and ensure that the datasets are large, diverse, representative, and properly labeled for metadata. For supervised learning, we would want to synthetically augment data for generalization and in semi-supervised learning, apply group level annotations. We will be exploring different deep learning approaches, various architectures to solve different variety of tasks, classification, and regressions.

Together, we can impact mental health on a global scale, and if you're ready to create groundbreaking technology in Emotion AI, we invite you to apply for our SWE internship role based in San Francisco where you'll get to build a world-class set of machine learning applications to scale across homes, offices, and commutes globally.

Emotion AI is a complex problem and emotional response is not trivial. In order to build an emotion estimation model, we will need to annotate data for audio and in a later iteration video. We will need to build supervised and unsupervised models and look at model performance and latency, address issues with bias, and ensure that the datasets are large, diverse, representative, and properly labeled for metadata. For supervised learning, we would want to synthetically augment data for generalization and in semi-supervised learning, apply group level annotations. We will be exploring different deep learning approaches, various architectures to solve different variety of tasks, classification, and regressions.

At Play. we are passionate about technology and sports, and we're looking for a bright, hungry, and talented Software Engineer Intern to join our iOS Development team. You will be in on the ground floor of launching an exciting new social media platform for sports fans, where you will have the chance to make huge contributions to the engineering team, while working on the latest in mobile application technology. We eat, breathe, and sleep all things sports, and so should you! If you're looking for an exciting company where you can grow your software development skills while rooting for your favorite team, apply today to become a part of the next top social media platform!

- Experience building iOS applications in XCode using Swift
- Deep understanding of UIKit
- Excellent communication skills and passion for tough technical problems

- Collaborate with Product Designers, Product Managers, Backend Engineers, and Data Engineers

Play. is making it easy to bring sports communities together. With teams at the heart of our decisions, Play. is eliminating the sideline, facilitating partnerships, and providing greater access to athletic information. Together, we are building products and services that help create an athletic system everyone can participate in.

Play. is a properly positioned company to address the shift to remote sports during a time of medical uncertainty. The platform served as a novel way for fans to commemorate the biggest sports events in 2019 and poised to scale in 2020. We’re continuing to grow and are looking for incredible talent that can help us achieve our mission.

Play. is headquartered in Playa Vista, Los Angeles County, California, but will work to accommodate remote roles amidst current conditions.

About The Role

As a software engineer on our Backend team, you will be building and owning certain backend services and infrastructure that power our core athletic products. You will also gain a unique look into how the US sports teams works on the inside and strengthen your athletic-domain knowledge. We strive for a high standard of engineering quality while solving unique scalability challenges. You will have high impact roles at a relatively small company for our user base.

Your Day-to-day Will Involve
Having a dedicated work deck and ability to set infrastructure to be used by the eng team
Hire Engineers to grow team and help products scale
Building, testing, and releasing product-facing features with stringent correctness and scalability requirements; these features could be related to market data, recruiting, or performance.
Designing a solution with other engineers and the ops team to fix a scalability problem and then implement it
Working with our frontend team to fine tune our REST API
Collaborating with our data team to support millions of customers
Contributing to open source projects

Some Things We Consider Critical For This Role
3+ years of software engineering experience
Solid understanding of relational databases and transactions
Familiarity with writing highly concurrent systems
Good intuition for REST API design

Bonus Points
Intimate familiarity of Node.js and/or Javascript

Core Tech Stack
Node.js as the main languages and frameworks of choice
MLab as our primary data store
Heroku as our hosting service
Feeling ready to give 100% to disseminate play to players, coaches, and fans everywhere? We’d love to have you apply, even if you feel unsure about whether you meet every single requirement in this posting. At Play., we’re looking for people invigorated by our mission, not just those who simply check off all the boxes.

What is ThoroStat?

ThoroStat is a horse racing wagering and recommendation platform that uses real-time data to provide users selections per race or to help build multi-race wagers. Our industry is still way behind when it comes to using technology but we want to grow into the #1 platform for all types of horseplayers from experienced daily players to casual fans who attend the largest racing days of the year.

What are we looking for?

We are looking for a Full Stack Developer(s) Interns to produce scalable software solutions and contoniue to build out our platform. You’ll be at the ground floor and open to this role being full-time or part-time as a side gig for your internship, and also staying on after credit is receive as long as you can dedicate time daily to the company. you should have a passion for FulL Stack Developmentor persuing a degree in the field to get real-time work experience or College credit.

As a Full Stack Developer intern, you should be comfortable around both front-end and back-end coding languages, development frameworks and third-party libraries. You should also be a team player with a knack for visual design and utility. We are a young start-up that is looking to revolutionize the Harse racing wagering/betting space by being best in class platofrm to provide users Real-time wagering selections/recommendations.

If you’re also familiar with Agile methodologies and Machine Learning, we’d like to meet you.

This role can be done remotely, but depending on the start and end dates of the internship, we will welcome interns to our campus if it is safe to do so. Zoox is taking all precautions necessary and complying with regulations to ensure the safety of our employees in the midst of the pandemic.

We leverage both high quality sensor data and high level semantic information to produce data-driven models of the future. This representation is tightly integrated into our planning software to deliver a safe and smooth customer experience.

Zoox's Road Network team is responsible for developing the tools and infrastructure necessary to build, curate, and manage our high definition road network.

Logileap is a software development company actively looking for a motivated college student who is willing to gain practical training and real-world experience in iOS development. This internship has been developed to help students and qualified job-seekers satisfy their educational goals while preparing them for a professional career.

This is a unique opportunity for interns to develop their skill sets and gain real-world experience. How do you know if this internship is right for you? You should be excited about learning new things and capable of doing your own research. You should also be self-motivated enough to set and maintain your own schedule. If you need to be micro-managed, this internship is not for you. While we provide guidance and support, you will be empowered to think like a small business owner and make decisions.

The intern will be responsible for supporting strategic projects from the start to full implementation. Communication and the ability to adapt to a fast growing and complex job environment are imperative skills.

Logileap is looking for summer interns who have basic knowledge of iOS development and will be given responsibility of projects, UI Improvements, debugging/testing and influence on what the project may be.


Core Responsibilities:

* Develop iOS applications for clients and internal teams

* Work with clients to gather project requirements and develop wireframes

* Plan and execute development, communicating milestones and challenges

* Improve existing published apps

* Work with developers to overcome problems they are facing when using our SDK

* Develop process to allow our support for the developer community to scale

* Produce high level APIs that allow external and internal developers to further decrease their development effort



Job Requirements:

* BS CS, EE, CE or equivalent

* at least 1 year in developing application software for consumer or industrial devices

* Strong in iOS development in consumer or enterprise:

* Published app in the app store is a plus

* Strong Objective-C and Cocoa Touch knowledge

* Strong CS fundamentals (especially object oriented design)

* Strong analytical problem solving skills using scientific method and design of experiments

* Excellent written and verbal communication skills, able to communicate complex technical issues to cross-functional teams


Preferred Skills/Experience:

* Masters or PhD

* Experience in advances iOS frameworks: Core Data, MapKit, Networking

* Experience programming for UX

* Experience using several 3rd party SDK frameworks

* Have designed, built and/or enjoy flying remote controlled aerial vehicles


This is an unpaid position designed to offer a supervised learning experience to a motivated self-starter.

PlanetRate Inc (planetrate.com) is a new start-up based on a revolutionary and transformative platform for ratings and reviews. The platform is currently translated in French, English and Romanian languages and is a portal to more than 2.7 million cities and over 250 countries.

Opportunity:

PlanetRate is currently looking to add a talented Back-End Developer to our IT team. You will have the opportunity to work on new projects that will have a direct, tangible, and visible impact on operations, logistics and improving the customer experience. If you’re tired to be just a cog in a big machine, this is the perfect job for you! There are no clients to please, our only goal is to make PlanetRate the best it can be.

This is a non-paying internship initially with the expectation that it will evolve into a full time, paying position with a generous equity award component (which will be very valuable, eventually as we see this company being very successful either as a standalone or a valuable acquisition target by a large company, more established company in one of the several markets this platform will aggressively compete and grab significant market share from). Our philosophy is that we are all motivated more if we enjoy what we do — which is why hours are flexible and may involve working remotely during the internship — and personally share in the company’s success.

This is a one-of-a-kind opportunity to get in at the ground floor and join a fast-growing startup. If this sounds challenging, exciting and fun, we want to talk to you.

You can tell us why static methods aren’t necessarily a bad thing and how to best test things. You can explain what O(n log n) means. You are creative, resourceful and open minded.

The short & sweet summary.

Twine helps companies like Evernote, Birchbox, and DollarShaveClub make smarter people decisions by using predictive analytics and visualizations that replace their clunky HR systems.

We’re a fast-growing SaaS company - growing 30% month-over-month and backed by industry leaders like Adam Grant, founders of billion dollar companies, and Sand Hill Road VCs.

Now we’re looking for software engineering interns who want massive impact and incredible growth opportunities in a rapidly scaling team.

Click here to see what one of last year's interns worked on!

What you’ll be doing.

  • Learn from excellent engineers a small, highly-collaborative team. You’ll join a world-class team, including engineers with 10+ years of startup experience and advisors who are founders/CTOs of billion-dollar companies.
  • Drive ambitious technical projects that immediately impact our users. Some upcoming projects: interactive data visualizations (React/D3), API integrations (Python/Airflow), and predictive notifications and alerts (pandas/numpy).
  • Grow incredibly quickly as our company scales. As an early team member, you’ll have massive ownership and a steep learning curve. You’ll pick up new responsibilities as you grow, and work directly with the founders.

What you’ve done.

  • You’ve built complex, modern web applications. You’re familiar with modern web technologies through class projects and previous work experiences. You’ve also led at least one significant project or technical initiative.
  • You’re hungry, ambitious, and excited to grow. Previous interns have learned more in their first week at Twine than in dozens of engineering classes. You learn incredibly quickly and are always looking to take on more challenges and responsibilities.

More about Twine.

Our team: Our CEO, Joseph, spent years immersed in people analytics research and helped found an innovation team at Nike that grew 10X in a year. He’s also an Inc. 30 Under 30 recipient.

Our technology: Our data ingestion pipeline (Python/Airflow) captures people data from recruiting and HR platforms and uses it to create valuable analytics and insights for our users. Our web application is built in Django and React/Redux, and we use D3 for advanced data visualizations. We use AWS infrastructure, and SaltStack to streamline dev ops, scaling, and deployment.

Our values:

  • Be intellectually curious and humble. Have an insatiable desire to learn, not to be right. Be a “learn-it-all,” not a know-it-all. Have strong convictions, but listen to and learn from others.
  • Believe in exceptional outcomes. Believe that ordinary people can do incredible things with the right attitude and will. Be positive, inspiring, and optimistic. (At the same time, acknowledge the demanding work ethic and drive required for success.)
  • Get it done. Focus on rapid learning and execution, and be willing to roll up your sleeves and contribute any way possible. Be indomitably resourceful, drive through obstacles, and deliver on goals.
  • Help others be great. Treat your teammates, customers, and partners with respect and kindness. Have positive impact on others in all interactions.

If the role isn’t an exact fit but you’re interested in learning more (we're hiring across the stack), send us a thoughtful note! jobs@twinelabs.com

description:
Our mission is to reduce preventable blindness in as many people as possible. Our focus is blindness caused by diabetes.

Over 40% of Americans are diabetic or prediabetic, and diabetes is the leading cause of blindness among working-age adults. A simple annual eye exam can reduce the risk of blindness by 96%. However, two-thirds of patients fall through the system due to the inconvenience and high cost of visiting eye specialists.

At the heart of Preventa stands our drive to prevent blindness by solving the problem of access and cost, enabling early, affordable, and reliable disease detection. Our novel and disruptive portable and low-cost retinal imaging device paired with an autonomous AI diagnostic software system can solve all these problems.

We are a seed-stage startup based in Silicon Valley. Our team consists of a well-respected ophthalmologist with 15+ years of clinical experience (ex-faculty member at UPenn), an algorithm developer specializing in computer vision and machine learning at MIT, a Ph.D. student at Stanford EE with extensive relevant background, and a former investor and operator in the healthcare space (Stanford GSB MBA).

We have secured 3 patents on our core design, received funding from multiple sources, and already have pilot paying clients.

We are looking for a talented optical engineer or a physicist to join our early team. The ideal candidate fulfills the following six criteria:
1. Passionate about making a significant social impact in a fast-growing for-profit startup
2. Excellent communicator and hard worker who is willing to think out of the box
3. Resourceful and never take NO for an answer
4. Prior experience in Google Dart or Flutter and AI / ML development
5. Familiarity with healthcare IT development and various federal and state regulations (HIPAA, etc.)
6. Ability to execute rapidly with prototyping

What you will get out of this position:
1. Founding member in a startup with huge potential and a stellar team
2. Equity stake commensurate with early involvement and contribution
3. Flat corporate structure and insights into an early-stage Silicon Valley startup with direct investor interactions
4. Develop a professional and personal network across multiple top institutions

With our user base quickly approaching 500,000, and the ambitious aim to replace the entire engineering stack, the product and technology improvements at Bubble are endless, and that’s where we need people like you!

We have already welcomed many talented college students to intern with us in a variety of short-term or longer-term projects at Bubble. If you’re thinking about alternatives to the remote academic environment this year, consider us. We’re always excited to meet passionate people with a computer science or related background, who want to roll up their sleeves and help us solve some pretty deep technical problems that could, in turn, change the tech landscape as we know it.

Bubble has a ton of surface area that is passionately loved by its users. Engineers at Bubble own end-to-end feature implementation, continually improve our user-facing experience and develop technology to improve our backend infrastructure. Sharing your skillset and developing your talent as an intern with our team would be a valuable extension of this. If you’re passionate about programming language expressivity, intuitive product design, and infrastructure automation, this is the team to join.

We tackle problems such as building a query optimizer that runs in the web browser, automating decisions about how to index our users' data, and designing logging and debugging tools that share a vocabulary with our visual editor. Although familiarity with our stack (which includes AWS, Postgres, Redis, Node, Coffee-Script, and ES6) is helpful, it's not a hard requirement. We look for high-achieving, intellectually curious engineers at various levels of professional experience (we do require coding fluency in at least one and preferably several languages). We value communication skills, empathy, those who love problem-solving.

If this sounds like something you’d like to be a part of, please submit your resume, and state the length of time you’d be available to potentially work with us. Semester or full-year interest preferred, but not a deal-breaker. Open to those who are authorized to work in the US through 2021 only.

The team is currently remote for the foreseeable future. If and when things reopen, we invite you to join us in our New York City headquarters. And don’t worry, we’ll supply you with everything you need to work at your best while you’re at Bubble.

Coffee Meets Bagel (CMB) is a dating app that’s getting to the heart of meaningful connections. And, like in any good relationship, we want to cultivate empathy, teamwork, and a celebration of different perspectives. We’re seeking candidates from diverse backgrounds that are just as excited about dating and relationships as we are. Sound like you? Keep reading!

Passion is principal, but it’s equally important that you’re excited to learn about backend or client technologies and what it means to be a team player. And if solving challenging engineering problems at scale makes your heart flutter, we want you for CMB’s Summer Internship Program!

About the Internship

As an intern at CMB, you’ll work on impactful projects with supportive mentors and contribute updates to our code that reach millions of users daily. It’s all part of working toward our company mission: to create real connections that inspire personal growth. That’s because we champion love, but we think that dating and relationships can be used by everyone as a lens for self-reflection, too.

CMB is currently seeking interns to work as backend or iOS engineers. You’ll have opportunities to work on exciting projects, ship code to our 10M+ user base and work in a fast-paced start-up environment. You will be supported through continuous mentorship with a full-time engineer, with regular 1-on-1s to provide regular feedback to ensure a positive internship experience.

Our job can be deeply challenging, but it’s also immensely rewarding and tons of fun! Even if you don't check off all the boxes, we encourage you to apply. CMB recognizes that talent comes from a variety of backgrounds and we would love to hear how you can make an impact here.

This paid internship will take place over 8-10 weeks and is located onsite in our SF (backend/iOS) or Seattle (backend) offices. We do not provide visa or relocation support at this time.

What You'll Bring!

  • For a backend internship, experience in Python. Experience in Django and SQL would be a plus but is not required
  • For an iOS internship, experience in technologies such as Swift, Objective-C, or other object-oriented languages
  • Experience working in a team-based environment
  • Currently pursuing a degree or bootcamp instruction in software engineering or a related technical field

Here are some examples of past intern projects:- Automatic content moderation. This helped improve our event-drives system for automated recognition of faces in photos, suggestive imagery, and abusive language in profiles. It also influenced business decisions and reduced manual workload by making automated moderation decisions in millions of photos! You can read more about this here: https://www.fastcompany.com/90403658/amazons-ai-is-helping-companies-battle-sleazy-user-generated-contentAutomatic

  • Scammer detection. This helped us find bad actors on our dating site. This project required analytics and a good dose of creativity to find new ways to tackle the problem. In collaboration with our data scientists, new scammer detection models were implemented to greatly reduce the amount of time it took to ban bad actors from our site.
  • UI/UX and feature experiments. We’re constantly developing new features and designs, and our past interns have planned, implemented and tested both.

Please indicate in your application if you are interested in backend or iOS. For more information contact us at internship@coffeemeetsbagel.com

Martin is a management consultant turned startup employee turned startup founder. He founded mobUX when he found a lot of friction in the mobile marketing space between what brands are putting out there and what consumers want and need to engage. This obsession combined with capitalizing on converging trends of mobile, web-apps, and what is currently offered, mobUX (Mobile User Experience) was born.
