description:
Us: A lean-startup-devotee, data-geeky, digital-nomadic, passionate group of city-lovers with a mission to (use data to) make places better and thereby make people happier, healthier, and thrive! More here: www.stateofplace.co

You: An empathetic, I'll-try-anything-once, consummate-people-lover, hustler-at-heart, customer-focused, independent, eager-to-learn, outbound-marketing-enthusiast, who is looking to get a taste of the startup rollercoaster, willing to roll with the punches in the juggernaut of a space that is B2G (and Enterprise) sales, ready to assist with managing our lead pipeline, and want to love life while working with a dynamic group of just plain-good people working to make the world (at least slightly) better!

The Skinny: State of Place can be traced back to 2003, when our Founder/CEO, Mariela, accidently became a data-geek while creating a tool to objectively measure the built environment characteristics that impact the way people feel about their cities. She soon embraced this new-found title, and began her consulting company, realizing that quantifying what made for good urban design - and calculating its tangible value - was actually the key to convincing people to make cities better (and thereby improve people's lives). Fast forward 13 years later, five years after first offering State of Place as a consulting product, we were awarded a grant from the National Science Foundation's Small Business Innovation Research program that funded the MVP (first saleable version) of our software. One year later, we have worked with 15 customers and counting and have an exciting (yet somewhat) untamed, ever-growing list of prospects.

Here's where you come in -- the combination of our Founder's internationally renowned reputation and our uber-aggressive inbound campaigns make it relatively easy to attract leads and interest. Now we just need help qualifying and managing those leads. We're also focusing more and more on exciting outbound marketing strategies and sales and are looking for someone to assist our Sales Manager implement this new system to prioritize, track, follow-up - and yes, close - deals more quickly and effectively in a way that is repeatable and (eventually) scalable.

What you get: This is an unpaid internship, but there is the opportunity for this to transition into a full-time, paid position depending on our close-rate and/or whether we secure outside funding (which we are currently seeking). Clearly, you'll get a ton of on-the-job training (you'd be mentored by our Founder/CEO and our Sales Manager), enjoy flexible working hours, and gain invaluable experience working with an innovative, fast-paced startup.

State of Place was launched in 2016 with the support of a Small Business Innovation Research grant from the National Science Foundation, a highly competitive program. We successfully completed the 2017 Mass Challenge Accelerator program (only 8% out of 1500+ startups were chosen) and the Kickstart Accelerator Smart Cities program in Zurich (where only 2% of applicants were accepted) as well as the Katapult Accelerator Impact Program in Oslo which provided us with investment capital (where again, only 2% of applicants were chosen)! So you'll also get access to amazing mentors we amassed through these programs and have the opportunity to be part of our ongoing, bootcamp-style deep dive into our customer acquisition!

Duration:

15-40 hours per week; min. 4 month commitment

Location:

Remote (work anywhere with internet access) but preference for those based in Boston, New York City, Washington DC, or Metro Detroit.

We are Moneyballing City-making. Join us in disrupting the urban planning and real estate industries - replacing the top-down, opinion-based, expert-driven approach accessible to a few with a data-driven, evidence-based one, accessible to the many!

We hope you're as stoked as we are to meet you/us! Attach your resume/CV with a cover letter in your Angel List application. If you have any questions, shoot them over to careers@stateofplace.co.

Keep on hustling,
Mariela

Us: A lean-startup-devotee, data-geeky, digital-nomadic, passionate group of city-lovers with a mission to use data to make places more livable, equitable, and sustainable so that people are happier, healthier, and can thrive! More here: www.stateofplace.co

You: An empathetic, eager-to-learn, data-driven/research/product development enthusiast, who is looking to get a taste of the startup rollercoaster, ready to assist us in our software and product development efforts to help us scale the business using AI/visual machine learning/data analytics. You want to love life while working with a dynamic group of just plain-good people working to make the world (at least slightly) better!

The Skinny: State of Place can be traced back to 2003, when our Founder/CEO, Mariela, accidentally became a data-geek while creating a tool to objectively measure the built environment characteristics that impact the way people feel about their cities. She soon embraced this new-found title, and began her consulting company, realizing that quantifying what made for good urban design - and calculating its tangible value - was actually the key to convincing people to make cities better (and thereby improve people's lives). Fast forward 15 years later, five years after first offering State of Place as a consulting product, we were awarded a grant from the National Science Foundation's Small Business Innovation Research program that funded the MVP (first saleable version) of our software. Two years later, we have worked with nearly 30 customers in the US and Europe and counting!

Job Responsibilities:

  • Candidate will work on the design of a wide variety of interfaces, including map-based, reporting, searching, and extensive data management.
  • Other skill-development opportunities associated with the job include dev-ops work, API interaction with servers, backend python work, and machine learning.

What you get: This is an unpaid internship, but you'll get a ton of on-the-job training (you'd be mentored by our Founder/CEO, CTO, and Machine Learning Scientist), enjoy flexible working hours, and gain invaluable experience working with an innovative, fast-paced startup. We also encourage interns to develop a professional development project that they can use to demonstrate improving a skill set or a deliverable/example of professional growth during the internship.

Duration:

15-40 hours per week; min. 4 month commitment

Remote (work anywhere with internet access) but preference for those based in North America and Europe (and time zones that line up with them)

We hope you're as stoked as we are to meet you/us! Attach your resume/CV with a cover letter in your Angel List application. If you have any questions, shoot them over to careers@stateofplace.co.

If you love using innovative technology to tackle tough science problems and working in a fast-paced, results-oriented team environment, keep reading to learn more about the Strayos Applied Scientist internship opportunity.

Here at Strayos, we use advanced computer vision and machine learning on images and machine sensors data to build insights for Mining, Infrastructure and Construction industry. Our applied science team uses these datasets to better understand our customers critical business operations and how it is changing. We are seeking three exceptional students with experience interpreting and processing imagery to join our applied science team during a three-month internship based at Strayos’ headquarters in Buffalo, WNY.

Over the course of this internship, you will work directly with our dynamic team of applied scientists who can share their deep knowledge of machine learning, remote sensing, geoscience, and physics. As an intern, you will learn how to implement novel, cutting-edge remote sensing and machine learning techniques to solve challenging research questions. To efficiently execute your solutions, you will access the Strayos' imagery archive and cloud-computing resources, and receive mentorship from one of our applied scientists. At the end of the internship, you will present your findings to the broader applied science team and learn more about future career opportunities at Strayos.

Responsibilities
Leverage our Python-based platform to query, access, and manipulate aerial imagery
Utilize machine learning or other classification techniques to analyze aerial imagery
Produce clear, concise results (e.g. ML models, statistics) for a project that can be completed during the course of the internship

Requirements
Candidates must currently be enrolled in an academic degree program in Geography, Geoscience, Earth Science, Engineering, Physics, Computer Science or a related field, within 1 year of completion.
Experience with Python & Numpy
Strong problem solving and critical thinking skills
Excellent written and verbal communication
Ability to work independently

Preferred skills:
Experience with machine learning and image classification
Proficiency with the following Python packages: numpy, scikit-learn, keras
Experience working with aerial or satellite imagery and geospatial data.

ONLY INDIVIDUALS PLS.
NO COMPANY OR AGENCIES

*UPTO 3 Months Remote-Unpaid-Parttime *

Variable Stipend • AVAILABLE- UNPAID- PERKS

Apply now

Minimum Experience: 0-2 years

Job Type: Full time/Remote

*APPLY ONLY IF YOU KNOW at least 80% of the Following TECH *

Who we are:

We are Sensegrass. Most innovative AgTech company to predict the fertilizers and water requirements from the soil in real-time using patented NPK Sensors. Our IoT+AI platform delivers relevant, actionable information alerts in real-time to improve the soil quality and crop yield. We detect the fertilizers and more than 15 parameters from the soil earliest on real-time risks within an increasingly diverse and complex landscape of soil land, enabling more effective decision making to farmers.

We’ve grown to more than 10 talented employees across four global offices and raised some pre-series in funding at a $1.5 million valuation in our most recent investment round. We are based at Paris, Santiago, Delhi and Uganda. Our culture promotes cross-team interaction, work-life balance and the sharing of information and ideas because it enables us to do our best work together and have fun.

We are a mission-driven company committed to the power of AI and IoT and real-time information as a force for good in the world. Join us and help the world operate in real-time to create a social impact with advanced technology.

Roles and Responsibilities

  1. Developing React Native Mobile App for IOS & Android architecture.
  2. Designing user interactions on Apps.
  3. Connecting with backend APIs.
  4. Creating servers and databases for functionality.
  5. Ensuring cross-platform optimization for mobile phones.
  6. Ensuring responsiveness of applications.
  7. Working alongside graphic designers for web design features.
  8. Seeing through a project from conception to finished product.
  9. Designing and developing APIs.
  10. Meeting both technical and consumer needs.
  11. Staying abreast of developments in web applications and programming languages.

What You Will Do

  • React Native app to build integrations when it needs for external services/between other business systems.
  • Manage our dev-ops stack, optimize content delivery, and manage site performance.
  • Responsive front-end coding in react native.
  • Communicating with other web developers to collaborate effectively
  • Collaborating with marketing team members to clarify requirements and obtain feedback 

Do you have the right ingredients?

  • 0-2 year’s experience designing, implementing and running Node.js servers in demanding high traffic environments.
  • NodeJS – Ability to produce clean, object-oriented code, include files, grab get/post variables and manipulate form data.
  • HTML5 & CSS3 – Some experience coding designs and layouts to a high standard, using media queries, and building robust layouts that work across devices and all major browsers
  • JavaScript – the ability to write custom JavaScript functions, event handlers,
  • Basics of Python
  • Ability to communicate clearly and professionally
  • Strong understanding of web application security principles and best practices - Node.js experience (our platform is Node-based).
  • Strong knowledge of git, and an understanding of code repository best practices
  • Ability to accurately estimate the time required for a project and keep to timelines
  • Experience working within a distributed team
  • MongoDB,
  • Redis
  • PostgreSQL
  • Node / Express
  • React
  • GraphQL
  • REST

BENEFITS/PERKS:

  • Fun team outings
  • Significant opportunity for growth in the company
  • Work alongside an incredible slate of clients and team members
  • Fun, creative and collaborative company culture

 
If you make the cut you’ll get...
•Profit/Revenue sharing -
•Stock options –actually stock grants as you don’t have to pay for them, you earn them via vesting.

The Problem

At its core, education has a fundamental data problem: schools run on legacy infrastructure that's impossible for developers to build on top of. We're on a mission to replace the terrible things that engineers have to do to build classroom software (think nightly CSV FTP transfers) with an API that feels more like Facebook's or Stripe's. On the school-facing side, we're looking to become a single place where schools can discover, integrate, and evaluate the dozens of in-class applications they're using.

When we started seven years ago, four schools used Clever. Today, Clever is used by over 78,000 schools, making it the fastest-growing company in education. We're looking for talented engineers who want to help us build Clever into something every school, student, and teacher relies on.

A Day in the Life

Interns at Clever work alongside full-time engineers, improving existing products and creating apps that live on top of Clever. Our very first intern wrote an iPhone app on the Clever platform that spread to over a thousand schools on the day it was released. Another intern wrote an app that let schools provision Google accounts, which now manages over 2 million student and teacher accounts.

Clever is mostly written in Typescript, Javascript, Node.js, and Go.

This is exclusively a summer 2021 (May - August / June - September) opportunity.

Requirements

  • Must be graduating in or before June 2022. Why is this? Clever only offers internships to college students who will be graduating within 9 months of their internship’s completion because we view internships as a path to a full-time offer. The internship program lets us identify and mentor future engineers, while offering the the intern a chance to see what it's like to be part of the Clever team. At the end of the internship, we hope to be able to build on a great summer by extending our interns an offer to come back and join us!
  • Relevant coursework in computer science.
  • Past projects demonstrating strong coding ability.
  • A desire to grow as an engineer through collaboration, code reviews, and learning new languages/technologies.
  • Excellent communication skills
  • A desire to work in a diverse, highly collaborative team environment

position: Disruptive FinTech Start Up looking for Front-end Development Intern
description:
Disruptive FinTech Start Up looking for Front-end Development Intern

Fluz Fluz is aiming to disrupt the global retail shopping experience through various consumer touch points. We are a FinTech company sitting in the intersection between blockchain, social media, payments and retail. We are a fast-moving company that has experienced rapid growth. Over the past year our team has grown from 5 members to over 45 and we are operating internationally. We are about to launch our US consumer cash back app.

We are looking for a front-end developer with complimentary design skills to build out landing pages. You will be working primarily within a Wordpress theme framework, collaborating with our UX and graphic design team to craft a variety of promotional and informational landing pages to support the Fluz Fluz rewards app. Having additional copy and design skills that allow you to advance through tasks self-sufficiently is a huge plus.

Responsibilities
Manage and customize Wordpress themes
Set-up new Wordpress environments
Work with the Fluz Fluz team to build out landing pages efficiently
Manage certain components of DNS and AWS infrastructure configuration
Implement all best practices for optimal performance in SEO, load time, responsiveness and analytics
Rolling competitive analysis

Requirements
2+ years building websites using HTML, CSS, JS
1+ years experience building websites on Wordpress
Ability to edit graphic assets in Photoshop, Illustrator, Sketch or an equivalent application.
Strong visual design skills and attention to details
Awareness of best-practices for web performance optimization
Experience running command-line tasks and knowledge of Gulp workflow is also a plus.

Salary
Competitive based on performance and prior experience.

EEOC

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

Learn more about us at FluzFluz.com

position: Internship in Windows Application Development (Remote & Unpaid)
description:
If you are looking to be a pioneer in creation of a seamless behavior of devices for its users, an opportunity to be part of an implementation of a new windows app from scratch to deployment, then come help us launch HuTouch.

HuTouch is part of an early stage startup in its concept phase. HuTouch is Dropbox for your activities, i.e., it will allow users to pick up their activities (apps, data, pointers) from where they stopped when they move between devices. Our 1st launch will help users move their activities seamlessly between Windows 10 PCs and Android smartphones, and vice versa.

With 30 early adopters willfully awaiting a raw prototype, HuTouch needs a windows application developer intern (specifically for UWP) to help accomplish the below goals & tasks (priority as stated):

  1. Research and development to identify solutions for functionalities designed by our early adopters. You will be required to have problem solving skills, study different materials and come up with solutions for functionalities within HuTouch that are not developed yet. This may take up 40% to 50% of your time on this project.
  2. Deliver code & User Experience not just with high quality but also with a logical flow in mind. The tasks associated to this job requirement is coding and unit testing, where the intern will need to make sure no critical or high defects creep into the developed code. This may take 30% to 40% of your time on this project.
  3. Demo of individual features developed and end to end flow. It'll be required for you to present the working app to the founder over a call while you screen share. There is no need for powerpoint presentations here, as this will be a pure demo of the app. This will take up 10% to 20% of your time on this project.
  4. Understand the flow within HuTouch and apply it to design frameworks for HuTouch. An intern will be asked to read about HuTouch, the platform (UWP) to think like an architect and identify any foreseeable risks during implementation. This will take up the remaining time on this project.

Visit www.HuTouch.com for more details & to see the demo video on our patent pending concept on continuity.

Skills required:

  1. Average to expert coding skills in UWP & Win32 platforms for windows 10
  2. Client side coding to interact with APIs for AWS or cloud solutions
  3. Problem solving skills that drives the urge to solve by looking at a problem from different angles/scenarios and presenting with multiple solutions.
  4. Communication skills to articulate the problem and clarify assumptions
  5. Self reliant to move the project forward

AgEye Technologies is actively seeking Computer Vision & Machine Learning Interns to join our AIoT Team in our Raleigh, NC office. You will be focused on developing and deploying image processing, machine learning or deep learning solutions that will have impact in the life sciences & agriculture industries.

In this role, you will gain valuable experience in cutting edge research in artificial intelligence and machine learning applications, and develop software solutions for real world, large scale problems.

Skills:

• Experience with one or more general purpose programming languages including but not limited to: Java, C/C++ or Python
• Experience with TensorFlow

Preferred Qualifications:

• Understanding of AWS or Azure cloud computing environments.
• Understanding of edge computing principals and architecture.
• Previous exposure to IoT based applications.


About AgEye Technologies

AgEye Technologies is pioneering the use of computer machine vision, deep learning neural networks and IoT-connected devices to create the next generation of intelligent agriculture solutions. We’re a dedicated team of agriculturists and technologists that have a passion for digital horticulture, artificial intelligence and creating a sustainable food supply for the growing global population. Our mission is to develop technology that will help produce better tasting, healthier crops that generate more profit, while also giving better visibility into large scale indoor farming operations. We provide our employees with a rich, creative and collaborative environment to further their skills, interests and experience in their particular field, and possibly other fields in which they display interest.

We are an equal opportunity employer. We welcome people of different backgrounds, experiences, abilities and perspectives. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran

description:
Position Summary:

We are looking for an enthusiastic software QA engineer to help us update the product documentation and improve the performance and usability of our mobile app and web-based subscription for brands and retailers. This position is both a technical product management position and a QA engineer position.

We are looking for a Quality Assurance (QA) engineer to develop and execute exploratory and automated tests to ensure product quality.

QA engineer responsibilities include designing and implementing tests, debugging and defining corrective actions. You will also review system requirements and track quality assurance metrics (e.g. defect campaign workflows and collaboration opportunities with matchmaking brands to creatives.)

The QA technician role plays an important part in our company’s product development process. Our ideal candidate will be responsible for conducting tests before product launches to ensure software runs smoothly and meets customer needs, while being cost-effective. If you hold an engineering background and enjoy providing end-to-end solutions to software quality problems, we'd like to meet you.

Ultimately, you should monitor all stages of software development to identify and resolve system malfunctions to meet quality standards.

Responsibilities

- Review requirements, specifications and technical design documents to provide timely and meaningful feedback
- Create detailed, comprehensive and well-structured test plans and test cases
- Estimate, prioritize, plan and coordinate testing activities
- Design, develop and execute automation scripts using open source tools
- Identify, record, document thoroughly and track bugs
- Perform thorough regression testing when bugs are resolved
- Develop and apply testing processes for new and existing products to meet client needs
- Liaise with internal teams (e.g. developers and product managers) to identify system requirements
- Monitor debugging process results
- Investigate the causes of non-conforming software and train users to implement solutions
- Track quality assurance metrics, like defect densities and open defect counts
- Stay up-to-date with new testing tools and test strategies

Requirements

- Proven work experience in software development
- Proven work experience in software quality assurance
- Strong knowledge of software QA methodologies, tools and processes
- Experience in writing clear, concise and comprehensive test plans and test cases
- Hands-on experience with both white box and black box testing
- Hands-on experience with automated testing tools
- Solid knowledge of SQL and scripting
- Experience working in an Agile/Scrum development process
- Experience with performance and/or security testing is a plus
- Pursuing BS/MS degree in Computer Science, Engineering or a related subject


Education/Experience:

- Current enrollment in an accredited university or development program
- Essential Competencies And Behaviors
- Highly self-motivated contributor who works well as an individual and within a team environment
- Strong written and verbal communication skills
- Detail-oriented and highly organized with the ability to multitask in a fast-paced environmenT.

Who we are:

Errunds is an online community marketplace that connects busy shoppers to local brick and mortars. We make it so that you have awareness of all the nooks and crannies in your community and so that you have 24/7 access to buy whatever you want, whenever you want wherever you're at in your community. While businesses on our platform are able to sell 24/7.

Who you are:

- You’re super scrappy and are ready to build something from the ground up and be part of something greater than yourself.
- You have an interest in community development, marketplace, artificial intelligence and/or machine learning.
- You’re quick to consider the best approach for difficult development problems and are always looking to improve your craft.
- You’re ready to dive in and help build a next-generation web application in an agile, sprint-driven method of product iteration.

- Excellent verbal and written communication skills, familiar with tools like Slack and Asana

- Support partner and community members
- Improve the team and company - be an active participant in our culture

Javascript, HTML, CSS, SQL, React; Js, Native, Redux, React Native

position: BardoVR Internship: BardoVR - An Interactive & Immersive Platform For Change
description:
BardoVR’s “AfterDeath” is an interactive, game-based VR simulation of the Tibetan Book of the Dead, which describes the journey consciousness takes from the moment of death until its rebirth in another form. Using mindful, meditation-based techniques- calm focus, equanimity, compassion - “players” access increasingly higher realms within the game-simulation, as they simultaneously deepen their meditation practice.

Who are we looking for? We are looking for smart, motivated, and creative people who are passionate about TRANSFORMATIVE TECHNOLOGY to join the BARDOVR. We are looking for people who want to change the world! Do you have an interest in Virtual Reality (VR), Fractal Generation, game design/development, health and wellbeing, data analytics/big data, games for change, positive psychology, neuroscience, Buddhism, psychedelics, or growth hacking? We are looking for you.

Projects Include:
*Virtual Reality (Vr) Design And Development
*Game Design And Development
*Procedural Generation In Game Design/Procedural Generation In Vr
*Fractal Technology
*Business Development/Partnership Outreach.
*Growth Hacking & Community Development
*Games For Change
*Serious Games

What will you get working with BardoVR?

  • Opportunity - we offer real world experience working in a startup that is improving people’s lives. You will work directly with our management team, technology partners, and wellbeing community .
  • Access - to a visionary group of transformative technology thinkers, innovators, entrepreneurs, and artists who want to change the world.
  • Mentoring - works with you to expand your skillset, add to your domain expertise, and grow your network.
  • Training - project management, software tools, and access to Wellbeing products and services.

A few things to know about this position:

  • Position is unpaid. We support CPT and academic credit internships (if your school offers these programs).
  • Equity compensation based on performance and long term role at BardoVRavailable.
  • Requires a minimum ~10 hrs per week (depending on role and responsibilities).
  • Requires a minimum commitment of 1-2 months (longer commitments - a plus!).

We believe that BardoVR can become a radical platform for change: an awe-inspiring gamified tool, grounded in ancient wisdom, that not only benefits meditators but specifically targets gamers and VR experience-seekers who otherwise might never come in contact with these profound teachings. It is a BIG vision! Are you interested?

We are looking for candidates that are interested in Transformative Technology, Virtual Reality (VR), Fractal Generation, game design/development, health and wellbeing, data analytics/big data, games for change, positive psychology, neuroscience, Buddhism, psychedelics, or growth hacking.

What will you get working with BardoVR?

  • Opportunity: Experience working with emerging VR and VR gaming technologies.
  • Visionary Product: Be part of the team that is building an awe-inspiring gamified tool that changes lives.
  • Access: BardoVR is working with a visionary group of transformative technology thinkers, innovators, entrepreneurs, and artists who want to change the world.
  • Training: Opportunity to work on a diverse range of projects (VR, data analytics, product development, biz development, and social media/marketing).
  • References/Recommendation

Please include your resume, and tell us what makes you unique! If you do not hear from us, please be patient – we are growing rapidly. More info @ https://www.bardovr.com/. Contact bst@bardovr.com for more info and/or with any questions!

Thanks.

Ben Simon-Thomas
Co-Founder/Executive Producer BardoVR

BardoVR team:
Tom Seidman - Writer/Director. Dartmouth College, American Film Institute (Directing Fellow). DGA Assistant Director for Robert Redford, Clint Eastwood, Peter Weir. Independent filmmaker. Meditiator/student of Buddhism for over 25 yrs.
Ben Simon-Thomas - Executive Producer. Buddhist-leaning entrepreneur and ecosystem developer. Founded startups in the 3D space (SoundFit: 3D Scanning & ODMS: parts-on-demand), social commerce (GroupGain), worked in health-care startups and life style modification businesses (PMRI). MA in Buddhist psychology, degrees in Religious Philosophy and Language.
Grant Anderson - VR Producer. Former Executive Director at Sony’s 3D Center working with filmmakers including Baz Luhrmann, Ridley Scott, Ang Lee. CGI work on Academy Award-winning teams for Titanic, Spider-Man. Former Studio Head, Jaunt VR. Recently produced location-based VR experience of the Marvel Universe for Disney.

HUNTER (www.gethunter.com), a boutique NYC digital marketing agency, is seeking its first hires. Work hand-in-hand with our founder and true digital marketing pioneer. We are looking for a passionate Web Designer who will partner with our customers and ensure their long-term success.

Developer will deliver high quality, modern WordPress content and landing pages to showcase our dynamic, fast-growing field service management platform. This position requires a combination of programming skills (namely PHP, HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript) and aesthetics (understanding element arrangements on the screen, the color and font choices).

As a top candidate for this role, you will have a passion for building effective, forward thinking, creative website experiences that engage service professionals and showcase our brand. You should have a strong understanding of conversion techniques, industry trends, content management systems, tag management systems and optimization tools. You will work with a team of marketers and designers to bring the best web experience to life. You should have extensive experience with end-to-end website creation, from creating visual designs to developing modern websites, always with responsive in mind.

Responsibilities

-Collaborate with marketing and design to develop best-in-class websites, using WordPress and other leading CMS tools
-Use latest web development techniques and standards, to create for all types of devices
-Optimize existing online content for design best practices, SEO best practices, and performance
-Help formulate an effective, responsive design and turning it into a working theme
-Design and implement new designs, landing pages, features and functionality
-Establish and guide the website and blog’s architecture
-Ensure high performance and availability, and manage all technical aspects of the CMS, website and landing pages
-Publish effective forms to capture and convert web traffic into sales opportunities

Skills and Qualifications

-2+ years of professional experience in web design and development
-A hunger for web design and development that sparks creative problem solving
-An understanding of WordPress theme creation, including taxonomies, page templates and best practices
-An appreciation for modern development techniques
-Experience with responsive and mobile design techniques
-Experience working with marketing and design staff
-A passion for UI/UX and streamlined ecommerce websites
-Experience with Adobe Suite
-A desire to thrive in a fast-paced and dynamic work environment
-Ability to understand CSS changes and their ramifications to ensure consistent style across platforms and browsers

description:
Algolia is leading the way in removing the frictional boundary between intent and content, providing industry grade search and discovery tools to drive richer, more powerful engagement and success capabilities to companies of all sizes. In this endeavor, we are seeking passionate and industrious Demo Engineers ready to join a hyper-growth business and market to help evangelize and drive technical success with our solutions.

Demo Engineers sit within the Pre-sales Solutions Engineering Organization who work cross functionally in a dynamic team environment with Sales, Marketing, Product, and Engineering. Demo Engineers are responsible for augmenting the efforts of the Solutions Engineers by translating requirements and prototyping innovative demo solutions in support of key opportunities, as well as leveraging the assets created into reusable tools across the company.

In short, you will work directly with solutions engineers and sales to build demos that wow our customers. This role offers candidates the opportunity to develop custom apps & integrations with many platforms including web, mobile and smart home devices. Your work will be showcased in all our documentation, industry events, webinars and marketing campaigns. You will gain exposure to a variety of use cases and learn how to position the product in a pre-sales environment. This role allows the candidate to gain transferable skills that will benefit a career in Field Engineering (Solutions Engineer, Architecture, Expert Services) Product, Engineering, Sales and more.

YOUR ROLE WILL CONSIST OF:

  • Working with the Solutions Engineers to implement storyboards based on strategic prospect goals into demonstrations and solutions that showcase the differentiated capabilities of Algolia.
  • Augment the sales team to provide prospects high quality demos to drive successful business outcomes and help developers understand what is technically possible with Algolia
  • Prototype and catalog technical content (ie. demos and code snippets) to show customers how to implement search best practice Design, experiment and build creative solutions for search and discovery on web, mobile and smart home devices
  • Build solutions using the tools and frameworks in the Algolia ecosystem in short timeline
  • Continuously learn, stay on top of industry trends and contribute to thought leadership in the Search and Discovery space Serve as a technical resource for our global field engineering team
  • Be a key team member on helping to close strategic deals and drive new revenue

WHAT YOU WILL LEARN:

  • How a search engine works
  • How to be an expert in implementing Algolia
  • How search relevance works
  • How a sales organization is structured
  • Client-facing dynamics: how to hold meeting, how to pitch, how to listen

YOU MIGHT BE A FIT IF YOU HAVE:

  • Experience with Git, HTML, CSS and Javascript
  • Design development experience
  • Problem solving skills and attention to detail
  • Ability to work/thrive in a rapidly changing revenue-generation environment
  • Great oral and written communication in English
  • Experience with Javascript framework such as Vue and React.
  • Experience designing mockups / wireframes / UI using tools like Photoshop, SketchApp
  • Mobile programming experience

description:
** Please note application instructions below **

Birdie needs a full stack Ruby on Rails developer to jump in and complete the latest iteration of the web app - then execute on the next iteration.

This would be a great opportunity for someone looking to build out his/her portfolio and/or earn credit towards a degree or certificate.

Birdie is looking for a super smart + ambitious rock star developer in a graduate or undergraduate program who is interested in entrepreneurship to help support our launch. Birdie is a platform that taps into your personal trusted network rather than the masses to help you decide what to watch faster - think goodreads.com for TV. Birdie is currently in Beta testing with a projected launch of Fall 2020.

The Software Development intern will focus on
1) completing the current version of Birdie in Ruby on Rails which includes user engagement features, database optimization, and addressing bugs as they arise
2) developing the next version of Birdie in React/Node

This opportunity is to start as soon as possible. If you're interested please apply here and send an email to jobs@birdieworld.com including your resume and a note telling me about the last great show you binge watched.

The ideal addition to the team would:

  • have experience with Ruby on Rails, React, and Node
  • be comfortable in an entrepreneurial environment - fast paced, wearing multiple hats, etc
  • unpaid - student must be able to obtain course credit or have a pre-approved program at his/her school that allows for this type of work
  • position is remote - can be located anywhere in the USA

We are looking for interns to serve on our Web Design team. Our focus is to develop an On Demand Learning Platform that makes access to quality instruction available 24/7. It is a 40-hour commitment per month initially and a ground-floor opportunity to help build something that will revolutionize learning, connect students from across the globe, and make a quality education available to all students regardless of where they live.

DISCLAIMER: In order to be considered for this position you must go to 247teach.org/web-design to complete an application. When your application is received someone from our team will contact you with next steps.

Ensure quality checks and proofing for any final produced items.

Participate in Company Wide Professional Development initiatives

Your primary focus will be the development of all server-side logic, definitions, and maintenance of the central database, and also ensuring high performance and responsiveness to requests from the front-end. Ready to change the way the world works? This is your chance to develop innovative new technology products, as well as your career. Hone your expertise alongside fellow talented professionals, where you'll develop some of the most exciting software solutions on the market. At Dmooji, we're strongly committed to the advancement of open Internet standards and applications as well.

As an Dmooji Software Developer, you'll use the latest tools and technologies available to deliver state­ of­ the­ art software. You'll be responsible for ensuring that company software components are expertly designed, tested, debugged, verified, and ready for integration into Dmooji’s best­ of ­breed solutions that help organizations improve their business outcomes in the global marketplace. Join us.

Description:
The position is for Software Developers who would like to join our growing team in our Santa Clara office driving new initiatives in Dmooji. As a part of the engineering team, you will be forging a new frontier that will change how we build software applications in the future and have the opportunity to get on the ground floor of an exciting product and a talented technical team.

We are building a new technology platform using open source technology, with a heavy emphasis on Node.js. Other technologies we use include JavaScript/React (front end) with a Hybird data store (sql and no-sql). At Dmooji, we firmly believe in the power of combining technology with an entrepreneurial spirit.
 Responsibilities:
• Architect and develop a state of the art next generation platform that will change how customers will build software applications in the future. • Work with cross-­functional development teams to roll out new software releases using continuous integration • Drive the design and build out of a new platform that delivers quality of services like social, analytics, commerce and governance
• Write high quality applications that can achieve massive scale • Instrument applications for real time monitoring and redundancy • Work in small, cross­-functional teams committed to building awesome applications adopting the Lean Methodology
• Innovate to maintain our competitive edge • Estimating work efforts • Refactoring and optimizing code for efficiency and maintainability • Knowledge of cloud, multi-­tenant environments are desired.

Responsibilities:
• Proven experience with full stack development for a high volume web application
• Demonstrated knowledge of JavaScript and ideally an understanding of Node.js
• Ability to architect complex web applications using frameworks and APIs • Experience with different data ­stores such as MySQL, MongoDB
• Ability to work in a collaborative environment with talented designers and product managers
• A passion for learning

Quick facts about our company:
- Alchemist Accelerator backed company
- The product is live with enterprise customers and is moving very fast via our team of remote engineers. You will join our team of engineers and help accelerate product development even more
- We have revenue, paying customers

This is an equity only role with % depending upon the candidate, and we do expect to hire full-time upon next fundraising milestone.

position: Firmware Software Intern (drone, pixhawk) for a flying vehicle startup
description:
NON-PAID, local near SANTA CLARA or SAN MATEO, California, 18+ candidates only, please.

Course credit available and eligible for a chance to receive stock options.

Requirements:

Firmware scripting, Drivers (modification), hardware SDK, STM32 Bootloader
Knowledge of C/C++ or Python
Basic knowledge of Linux
Hardware/Protocols - STM32, UART, I2C, USB, CAN, ST Link, optical sensors

Unique opportunity to have a real hands-on experience in an upcoming trillion dollar industry - flying vehicles. Personal Aerial Vehicle (flying vehicle) is a combination of a VTOL aircraft, drones, and airplanes.

NON-PAID part-time Intern will get a unique opportunity to learn from industry experts, have a hands-on experience which later can be used for a resume, personal reference from one of Silicon Valley CEOs, chance to meet with famous VCs, and opportunity to earn a full time engineering position at Armada.

About Armada:

Armada is a startup funded by tier-1 Silicon Valley VCs. Office, where you will be working, is in Santa Clara, CA. Armada has a small but experienced team with multiple PhDs on-board and experienced employees from 15 to 30 years of experience.

Tasks:

You will support the design and development of a new personal aircraft.

Job Type: Internship

We want to offer you a challenging and rewarding opportunity where you can kick-start your career. You will be working closely with our engineering team who will provide mentorship and guidance every day.

The pay is $12-25/hour, and you will be asked to work from the office.

We will work together to help you fulfill your potential. There is no ceiling at pulseM, and we want to make sure everyone feels empowered to have an impact in the company. We would love to eventually see you as a new full-time Full Stack Developer, Team Leader, or even CTO!

Real-world depth vision data is all around us, and largely uncaptured and uncatalogued. Lucid is a computer vision startup which developed an AI-based 3D depth sensing solution to enable any dual camera device like mobile phones, robots, laptops and more to see depth through machine learning.

We are searching for a passionate image processing engineer who loves working on developing code for video and image processing, graphics distortion, 2D/3D rendering, image calibration and app/website video integration. This person will be developing the face and backend of our camera and distribution, as every video we create will go through him.

A huge plus would be if you also know OpenGL which will drastically accelerate your learning during the development. If you want to work on a technology which will change the future, then apply to Lucid and help us disrupt 2D videos and pictures through AI-enhanced depth and 3D.

Additional skills as bonus:
database design, implementation, and deployment, handling large files on a website backend, streaming files to clients over the Internet, storing and managing large data, setting up social network like websites, including video players in websites, HTML5 canvas experience, OpenGL experience, shared login experience with Facebook, Amazon, etc., AJAX experience, syncing data between websites, databases, and apps, video processing, stream videos live, handling large amount of network traffic, designing websites with multiple servers

location.city: Los Angeles • Venice Beach • Venice • Remote

description:
Are you passionate about journalism? So are we!

Happs is a mobile news network that live-streams the most fascinating, important, and interesting “happenings” in the world. In an era where traditional news outlets have become antiquated, Happs is putting power in the hands of a new generation. We are building a global community of contributors who are armed with smartphones, have a passion for storytelling, and are determined to bring untold stories to the forefront—stories that compel, fascinate, spark discussion, shock the conscience, generate awareness and inspire the next generation.

Our team of news and startup innovators have built and exited multiple large and successful companies, including Channel One (acq $200M), Current TV (acq $500M), Reserve Media (acq 2018), and ZypMedia. We are backed by amazing investors like Corazon Capital, Happy Street Ventures, and the founder of Firebase.

Happs is looking for a Software Engineer Intern who is interested in learning how to plan, architect, and implement mobile and web application software. Interns will work directly with our Engineering team and get a hands on experience with a technology start-up. You will get experience with a variety of modern software development strategies such as continuous delivery, test driven development, code reviews, and agile development.

What you'll do:

• Learn to write elegant and expressive code by working directly with our team of Full Stack Engineers
• Learn how to architect and structure software for scalability, reliability, and ruggedness
• Learn how product development is planned, implemented, and iterated on by working with our Product and Design team

Skills:

• Currently studying Computer Science or a related field
• An eagerness to experiment, a determination to contribute, and a love of learning how to build great software

Nice to have:

• Some experience building Web Applications with modern web frameworks.
• Some experience with either Swift, Java or Vue.
• Some experience with Firebase

INTERNATIONAL VOLUNTEERING INTERNSHIP IN AN INTERNATIONAL FEDERATION

Human Connection Economy 4.0 (HCE 4)

Description: Virtual Internship

Length: Three to six months

Location: New York (USA). Remote working.

HCE 4 Headquarters: Villeurbanne, Lyon, France, European Union

HCE 4: HCE 4 is a professional, international and innovative federation that accompanies organisations and businesses that wish to migrate towards the 4th Industrial Revolution (also known as Economy 4.0). HCE 4 services integrate new concepts for management and marketing through putting the human, human connection and the planet at the heart of companies; and all around them through their clients. This is the Human Connection Economy 4.0. We are a Social Business that have just launched, seeking to become a part of the Fourth Sector. And we are in our start-up phase. Our outlook is global and we are specifically focussed on North America, Europe, Latin America and Asia. You can find more information about us at www.hce4.com.

Technology 4.0 Strategy Internship (Engineering)

Internship Objectives (to be finalised during the on-boarding process):

  • Participate with the conception and construction of New Technology 4.0 (Artificial Intelligence, Biotechnology, Humanoid Robots) training sessions.
  • Integrate new types of training and conception inspired by neuroscience (e.g. connected creativity). There will be training sessions to prepare the student.
  • Analyse competition and client needs.
  • Lead training sessions.
  • Development towards the co-management of the team.
  • Create and organise HCE 4’s professional seminars and conferences.
  • Create links with the world of New Technology 4.0 and HCE 4 services.
  • Very motivating, diverse and innovative missions.

Student Profile:

  • Undergraduate/Masters student studying Engineering. Also open to students who are very motivated by new technologies who are enrolled in a Masters course.
  • Additional languages than English are appreciated but not compulsory.
  • Good command of Office (Word/Excel/Power Point) and have access to this on their own laptop.
  • Very autonomous and independent – a fast learner.
  • It is not necessary to have existing knowledge of new technology, human management, or human marketing as this knowledge will be developed through training with HCE 4.
  • Ability to work full-time during the period of your missions.

Here at Plaid, we believe that the way consumers and businesses interact with their finances will drastically improve in the next few years. Our goal is to enable innovators to create the next generation of financial services applications by laying the groundwork for these companies to succeed. Plaid SLC is central to this mission as we focus on getting data from financial institutions directly into the Plaid ecosystem.

As a software engineering intern at Plaid, you will be working directly alongside the teams that are addressing the challenges that come with intelligently supporting over 9600 unique financial institutions. We work primarily in the backend using Typescript, with the opportunity to collaborate on other parts of the system written in Go. You will have the opportunity to debug, fix, and write your own code that will power this system.

Neither technology mentioned above is a prerequisite; rather, we are looking for people who are excited to join the team and use problem solving skills to make a large impact on fintech, the developers who power it, and its everyday users.

We believe that the way consumers and businesses interact with their finances will drastically improve in the next few years. Plaid's goal is to enable this shift by building the tools and infrastructure that allow developers to create the next generation of financial services applications. As a software engineer at Plaid, you'll be integral in building and scaling the APIs that help us all achieve this vision.

We’re architected around decoupled services. You could be working on our internal distributed systems framework that holds them all together, or building out the newest version of our API. Most of our back-end core systems are written in Go, but that's not a prerequisite. We pick the right tool for the job and have systems in Go, TypeScript, and Python.

This position is located in New York City.

What excites us

  • Degree in engineering, CS, physics, math, statistics, or another related field
  • Strong track record of building interesting projects, whether during internships, for school, or independently
  • Great fundamentals and a strong command of at least one language
  • Product mindset. You understand that building the right tools and systems can impact millions of users
  • Adaptability. Most of our engineers work across the entire stack, touching everything from the front end to our core infrastructure

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

We’re looking for a summer intern who is hungry to learn and eager to contribute. This is a unique internship opportunity for someone who wants to do meaningful work while gaining first-hand experience working at an early stage startup.

What you’ll do:
-Work directly with our CEO/CTO to rapidly prototype improvements to our infrastructure
-Help identify and build enhancements to our core prediction algorithms
-Iterate directly with our investment team
-Potentially take on larger projects associated with our research process / explore different investment strategies

Who you are:
-Completing your junior or senior year as an undergraduate, or working towards your PhD
-Ambitious, curious, resourceful, with a positive attitude
-Work well within a team, but also enjoy alone time to think more deeply
-Solid programming skills - in particular python and C/C++
-Comfortable using Linux
-Familiar with data structures and algorithms
-Comfortable taking on work across the stack
-Bonus: Familiarity with large scale data analysis / machine learning
-Bonus: Excited about working with financial markets data and learning about trading

About the role:

  • This is a paid internship based in San Francisco
  • You will work out of our office in the Presidio - a beautiful national park by the Bay
  • The internship will be 10-12 weeks long - with the possibility of extension to a full-time position

location.city: Mountain View • San Francisco Bay Area • Remote

description:
Job Overview

zGlue is an early stage startup creating a solution that will miniaturize and democratize hardware designs. We are a rapidly growing engineering team working on a fully vertical hardware and software stack. There are a lot of opportunities to contribute and lead at every level of the stack, and your work will be customer visible and immediately impactful.

We are looking for the Software Intern. The ideal candidate would be a self-driven, results-oriented and is looking for real-world engineering opportunities at an early stage Silicon Valley startup. You will be working closely with Hardware, Firmware, Business and Marketing to help define and build a scalable software platform based on zGlue's proprietary technology. You will have the opportunity to innovate and build new applications, as well as the opportunity to learn about real system design and develop a solution from concept to product.

Responsibilities

Design and implement the SaaS CAD applications
Design and implement the database that meets the capacity and performance specification.
Collaborate with other members of the engineering team to implement the backend algorithms of the CAD
Collaborate with the front-end developer to build the User interface of the CAD

Qualifications

Bachelor, Master degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering or related fields
Strong concept in data structure and algorithm
Strong technical problem-solving skills
Experience in data modeling and SQL
Experience in software development
Experience with major programming languages such as Python and JavaScript
Experience with Web technologies such as HTML, CSS and React
Good team player
Good communication skills

Compensation

Stipend

Benefits and Perks

Local: Fruits, snacks, drinks, catering, happy hour, sports, company events

About the internship

We are looking for a developer Intern to join the mobile team. This team is responsible for providing engaging and delightful experiences for our Hybrid, iOs and Android applications. We do that while striving to build modern, extensible and robust applications. The Intern will join the team in the design, development, maintenance and monitoring of these and new applications.

The goal of the mobile team is to constantly improve the software tools used by our community of drivers/couriers leading to higher performance on their daily deliveries. The mobile team designs and builds new components while improving existing features.


Requirements:

- Good communication skills.
- Proactive and passionate attitude.
- Technical skills in applicable technologies such as React Native and Javascript
- Familiarity with iOS or Android native technologies and proven knowledge of - UI/UX development is required.
- Proficiency in object-oriented analysis, design, programming and component-based development. Strong competencies in data structures and algorithms.
- Good understanding of server-side logic.
- Experience with modern development tools and workflows such as git, GitHub or equivalents.
- Understanding of fundamental design principles behind a scalable application
- Write human readable and clean code using good practices .
- Use of design patterns such as Observer is a plus.

Responsibilities:
- Gathering functional requirements and developing technical specifications
- Build hybrid or native mobile applications depending on the current need
- Familiar working with REST APIs for deep integrations with both platforms
- Experience with JavaScript and its nuances including ES6 + syntax
- Develop high performing client-side applications
- Work in new features retrieving new information
- Manage and control data concurrency.
- Synchronize and store real time information and transactions
- Enhance, maintain and optimize current components
- Weekly report of the progress made.


Benefits:

- Flexible working hours schedule
- Gain valuable work experience and teamwork skills
- Multicultural Workplace ( You will learn from all the countries we are established in the region)
- Knowledge driven and global mindset culture
- You are welcome to any of our offices in the countries we operate.
- Build a network with professionals in the field
- Achieve a sense of accomplishment by contributing to a growing organization

Who We Are

Tonal has built the world’s most intelligent fitness system that is changing the way people work out at home. Tonal is a fresh approach to fitness that leverages hardware, software, video content, and artificial intelligence. Everyone who has seen or used our product, from professional athletes to fitness enthusiasts, has fallen in love.

At Tonal, we are applying our collective knowledge and creativity to reimagine fitness. We know firsthand that too many hurdles stand between each of us and our fitness goals. Drawing on decades of research and a diverse team of experts, we have created the most advanced strength training system available that makes working out more efficient, effective, and engaging.

We're passionate about building products that transform people's lives.

Overview

The Mechanical Engineering team is looking for a motivated undergraduate or graduate student in Mechanical Engineering or Electrical Engineering who is taking a reduced course load or no courses during the Spring Semester of 2021 (or Winter + Spring Quarters), from approximately January to May and work at Tonal approximately 30-40 hours per week. This job is located in Milpitas, California, with occasional visits to San Francisco.

What You Will Do

  • Evaluate electrical and mechanical characteristics of components, sub-components, and systems to determine the root cause of failure
  • Interact with design, firmware, process, test, and reliability engineering to solve problems
  • Prepare concise and detailed failure reports and recommend corrective action to prevent reoccurrence of problems
  • Provide feedback to Engineering and Operations teams to improve product reliability
  • Partner with the development teams and Operations to drive root cause from field failures
  • Help with electro-mechanical detail product/system/module design
  • Work on a personal project or exploration that lasts the length of the internship

Who You Are

  • Student in Mechanical Engineering or Electrical Engineering pursuing a BS or MS degree
  • Knowledge of a variety of materials and manufacturing technologies
  • Strong oral and written communication skillsHandy with metal/wood shop tools or basic electrical debugging techniques
  • Hands-on problem solver, prototyper
  • Collaborative style

position: CV, NLP & ML Engineer Intern (Spring, Summer, Gap Year)
description:
CV, NLP & ML Engineer - Intern

(Spring, Summer, Gap Year)

About Us

There are products that customers think are cool at the moment, and then there are products that customers cannot live without because they are so incredibly useful. At Matician, we are building the latter because these are the products worth spending our lives on. We want to build great products to solve real problems.

We believe that sensors and algorithms are finally good enough to reimagine home devices and apply Level 5 autonomy and mobility so that people can save time and energy bypassing repetitive and mundane tasks inside the home.

We're a small team with a singular focus on product that combines technologies such as vision, ML, structure-from-motion, and robotics. Our goal is to ship products that people love.

Job Description

Computer Science/Engineering Student to join our early core team in the process of receiving a BS/BEng or MS/MEng or related discipline.

We’d love to hear from you if:

  • You are genuinely motivated to help those around you, including users at various levels of experience.
  • You are passionate about tackling large complex projects and are adaptable to learning outside your normal comfort zones.
  • You love diagnosing complex technical issues and providing hands-on support for hardware and software solutions.
  • Your curiosity to learn and grow is inversely proportional to your level of ego.
  • You are excited to do great work.

Qualifications

  • Ability to solve problems and identify areas of improvement
  • Ability to write clean, reliable code that can be easily maintained
  • Experience with Python, Experience with Tensorflow, PyTorch or Numpy a plus
  • Experience with working on computer vision, machine learning or NLP problems
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced, autonomously driven, and demanding start-up atmosphere.

Responsibilities

  • Collaborate with the HW, SW and Algorithms team to bring product vision to life.
  • Everything involved in applying an ML model to a production use case
  • Designing and coding up the neural network architecture, gathering and refining data, training and tuning the model
  • Deploying it at scale with high throughput and uptime
  • Analyzing the results in order to continuously update and improve accuracy and speed

position: Embedded & Linux Systems Engineer (Fall, Spring, Summer, Gap Year)
description:
Embedded & Linux Systems Engineer - Intern

(Fall, Spring, Summer, Gap Year)

About Us

There are products that customers think are cool in the moment, and then there are products that customers cannot live without because they are so incredibly useful. At Matician, we are building the latter because these are the products worth spending our lives on.

We believe that sensors and algorithms are finally good enough that we can apply level 5 autonomy and mobility in order to reimagine home devices. We want to save people time and energy by circumventing the mundane tasks inside the home. We are building great products to solve real problems and ship them to the people we love. We are a mission-driven and tight-knit group that values learning and curiosity in a high-risk, high reward culture.

We’d love to hear from you if:

  • You are genuinely motivated to help those around you, including users at various levels of experience.
  • You are passionate about tackling large complex projects and are adaptable to learning outside your normal comfort zones.
  • You love diagnosing complex technical issues and providing hands-on support for hardware and software solutions.
  • Your curiosity to learn and grow is inversely proportional to your level of ego.
  • You are excited to do great work.

The Opportunity

  • Develop core device functionality from the ground up.
  • Work with both EE and software teams to ensure feature feasibility.
  • Perform root cause analysis of system crashes and hardware failures.
  • Identify bottlenecks to improve system performance.

SKILLS

  • Strong experience in multi-threaded C and C++ is a must
  • Strong familiarity with userspace Linux programming and conventions
  • Working knowledge of Linux kernel internals
  • Knowledge of common communication protocols (e.g. USB, RS232, TCP/IP/HTTP)
  • Experience with microcontrollers is a plus
  • Familiarity with a systems scripting language, such as Shell or Python

JOB DESCRIPTION
RoboDel is looking for a Robot Engineer Intern. The primary focus will be on the navigation software of ground-based mobile robots. This include building software for planning, controls, SLAM, etc. The incumbent should be capable of building and delivering functioning robotics systems software that will be deployed on a global scale.

PREFERED QUALIFICATIONS

  • Experience in SLAM
  • Experience in ROS
  • Experience in Python or C++
  • Strong Computer Science fundamentals in algorithm design, problem-
  • solving, and complexity analysis;
  • Demonstrated ability to design, implement, and test software in a fast-paced environment;
  • Experience in working with sensors, actuators, and other
  • electromechanical devices.

TERM
At least 20 hours per week. The best candidate later will be offered a full-time position.**

APPLICATION PROCEDURES:
Interested candidates are welcome to apply for this position by sending resume
and a cover letter to: info@robo-del.com indicating the position title
("Robot Engineer Intern") in the subject line of the email.

We are looking for an Intern - Android Development who possesses a passion for pushing mobile technologies to the limits and will work with our team of talented engineers to design and build the next generation of our mobile applications.

Selected intern's day-to-day responsibilities include:

  1. Designing and building advanced applications for the Android platform

  2. Collaborating with cross-functional teams to define, design, and ship new features

  3. Working with outside data sources and API's

  4. Unit-testing code for robustness, including edge cases, usability, and general reliability

  5. Working on bug fixing and improving application performance

  6. Working on continuously discovering, evaluating, and implementing new technologies to maximize development efficiency

Get ready for a real learning experience working with big data in a fast paced start-up environment. From the onset you'll be matched with an individual mentor, and from there quickly work towards committing production code within your first two weeks. During your internship, you'll be tasked with numerous mission-critical projects while making meaningful other contributions to 180byTwo's success. And did we mention you'll have fun while you are doing it.

We welcome interns any time of year. Starting dates are flexible, and internships typically last a minimum of 12-14 weeks. Should we want to extend you a full time offer after you graduate, we ask that you would be willing to consider this at the end of your internship. We are seeking interns interested in full-stack web development and big data back-end engineering.


Responsibilities:

o Responsible for writing high-performance, reliable and maintainable code
o Hadoop development, implementation and support
o Loading from disparate data sets
o Pre-processing using Hive and Pig
o Designing, building, installing, configuring and supporting Hadoop
o Maintain security and data privacy
o High-speed querying
o Propose best practices/standards
o Web-Application based on Java

Qualifications:

o Self-starter: ability to take the initiative and work independently.
o Strong Java/Python coding skills that you are ready to further refine.
o Within 2 years of graduating from a 4 year University.
o Capacity to learn new techniques, languages and platforms extremely fast.
o Strong teamwork orientation, good interpersonal skills, and a proven ability to work effectively with a range of clients and colleagues.
o Type S(startup) personality: smart, ethical, goal oriented, hard-working and proactive. (required)

Employee Benefits:

o People. Work with talented, collaborative, and friendly people who love what they do.
o Fun. We host events such happy hours, friendly competitions, and team outings.
o Pay. This is a unpaid internship.


180byTwo is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate in recruiting, hiring, training, promotion or other employment of associates or the awarding of subcontracts because of a person's race, color, sex, age, religion, national origin, protected veteran, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetics or other protected status.

To all recruitment agencies: 180byTwo does not accept agency resumes for internships. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, 180byTwo employees or any other company location. 180byTwo is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

position: Social Media, Branding, Video/editing/story boarding, UI, mobile
description:
Globex Health is an outside the box digital health company with doctors, nurses and technologists. We enable telehealth, provide remote patient monitoring, we have a stealth blockchain in health product and some exposure to genomics. We are developing a digital health marketing and branding campaign. Looking for some skills and social good-minded people to help with people who have some experience and want to get more experience.

PartRunner is a new Boston-based startup that is revolutionizing how logistics are done in the Trades, Construction, Service, and Wholesale Distribution Industries. We are a B2B on-demand delivery service and leverage a network of independent drivers that have all types of vehicles; from small cars to 24ft Box Trucks. Our platform allows companies to request, manage and track all deliveries.
Our mission is to help companies in their logistics and supply chain efforts to allow them to work more efficiently while at the same time reducing costs.

• Knowledge of UNIX/Linux work environments
• Knowledge of standard web technology (HTTP, HTTPS, HTML5, client/server model)
• Solid understanding of JS like angular 8, react and redux
• Experience with git and the Gitlow workflow.
• JavaScript development beyond jQuery.

This will be a remotely administered internship with an immediate starting date upon hire. We will be able to accommodate different schedules and time zones including your academic calendar. In this role you will receive considerable levels of autonomy and ownership over your projects. Due to current market conditions, there will not be any compensation. We will be happy to provide recommendation letters, references, and resume items for your time at PartRunner

• Entrepreneurial minded and self-driven
• 3-6 Months of Sales or Customer Success Experience
• Have some knowledge in the Trades or Construction Industry
• Available to work remotely if required

Be part of an exciting team and have the opportunity to be involved with a Boston startup!

Metanoea team is working to revolutionize the finance industry by streamlining the process of digitization. Metanoea is pioneering a fundamentally new paradigm in the B2C and B2B sectors. In addition to being an excellent TypeScript or JavaScript developer, you are proficient with at least one No-SQL or SQL database (like DynamoDB) and have experience developing solutions using a number of AWS products like Amplify, Lambda, Cognito, SES, SNS, SQS, S3, etc. You have developed and supported RESTful APIs. You have strong problem solving and debugging skills that extend to the client-side, network, and beyond.

And ideally, you have a good grasp of basic technical architecture design and, in particular, you understand how to construct solutions using the facilities of the AWS cloud. You are able to manage trade-offs with respect to robustness, simplicity, scalability, and speed of development.

8 hours per week! Weekends and evenings!

Code test.

Work hard. Be a team player. Serve the clients. Build your career.

Software development interns will be continuing the development of a personalized medicine software platform that informs clinicians how patients will respond to pharmaceutical drugs. We incorporate factors including genetics, symptom profiles, desired drug properties, concomitant medications, comorbidities, family history, medical history, lifestyle factors, among others in this analysis. This analysis enables doctors to prescribe the safest and most effective medications for their patients and is currently being used in clinics across the country. This position is focused on front-end development.

Software development interns will be continuing the development of a personalized medicine software platform that informs clinicians how patients will respond to pharmaceutical drugs. We incorporate factors including genetics, symptom profiles, desired drug properties, concomitant medications, comorbidities, family history, medical history, lifestyle factors, among others in this analysis. This analysis enables doctors to prescribe the safest and most effective medications for their patients and is currently being used in clinics across the country.

Software Engineers will be continuing development of a software application that underlies next-generation mental health clinics across the Bay Area. Used by our clinicians, patients, and operations team, our software analyzes genetics, symptom profiles, desired drug properties, concomitant medications, comorbidities, family history, medical history, lifestyle factors, among others to determine risk scores and optimal treatment plans for our members. Software engineers should also expect to build algorithms to analyze the outcomes of treatment.

Software engineers have vast leverage and will be directly impacting the care our clinicians provide by building technology to empower our members to reach their optimal state of mental well-being.

The ideal candidate is passionate about transforming mental healthcare and is comfortable in a fast-paced environment. A desire to learn in essential in succeeding in this position.

Our Company Sezzle is a cutting-edge fintech company whose mission is to financially empower young consumers. Only one in three millennials own a credit card, and the vast majority of millennials possess a subprime credit score or no score at all. To address these problems, Sezzle has built a payment platform that increases purchasing power for consumers by offering interest-free installment plans at online stores. This increase in purchasing power for consumers leads to increased sales and basket sizes for the thousands of eCommerce merchants that currently work with Sezzle.

  • A hard-working mentality. It’s early and there is still a lot to build.

  • A fun attitude. Life’s too short. We can have fun while we work hard on cool things.

What Makes Working at Sezzle Awesome? At Sezzle, we are more than just brilliant engineers, passionate data enthusiasts, out-of-the-box thinkers, and determined innovators; we are skilled musicians, yogis, cyclists, chefs, golfers, dog-lovers, and rock-climbers. We believe in surrounding ourselves with not only the best and the brightest individuals, but those that are unique and purpose-driven in all that they do. Sezzle recognizes and values the importance of diversity and inclusion in enriching the employment experience of its employees and in supporting our mission. Our culture is not defined by a certain set of perks designed to give the illusion of the traditional startup culture, but rather, it is the visible example living in every employee that we hire.

Sezzle provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, creed, gender, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, and related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, genetic information or characteristics, marital status, familial status, veteran or military status, status regarding public assistance, membership or activity in a local commission, or any other protected status in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws.

DTonomy is a Cybersecurity company solving a critical problem facing Security teams today: too many alerts and incidents that exceed the capacity of skilled professionals to investigate and resolve them. Organizations today have hundreds to thousands of daily alerts from hundreds of sources and these numbers will only continue to grow. Most organizations are short staffed which results in inconsistent investigation processes, high mean time to response, increased risk and analyst burnout.

DTonomy’s Assisted Incident Response platform (AIR) orchestrates hundreds of internal and external data sources and tools into a single platform, and leverages automation and artificial intelligence to enable analysts to triage all alarms and threats, not just the highest rated or most critical, without additional investment in resource.

AIR’s unique adaptive learning engine and automated workflows guide IT teams through steps and procedures, resulting in up to 10 times quicker resolution of incidents, decreased downtime, and reduced alert fatigue for staff.
